name: Horse Cottage (Backpacker's Paradise)
description:
Formerly known as Backpacker's Paradise. 
Excellent mosquito-screened common area with tables, hammocks, power and a kitchen. Super friendly owners.  Wifi – Download speed 30Mbps – Upload speed 10Mbps in the restaurant and common areas. There is a dedicated modem in the common area/kitchen. 
Horses roam around free on the campground, its a unique experience to connect with those awesome animals. 

For ioverlander travelers we have a special rate of 20$ US per person per night and 10$US a day per vehicle for storage when guests leaves their vehicle here to go with the boat to the islands.
Laundry Service is available for US$10 per load.

name: Sandy Lane
description: Very basic. Shared bathrooms but awesome hot showers. There was a place to grill and covered picnic tables outside, but no kitchen. Probably the cheapest place to stay on Caye Caulker if you don’t have a tent and don’t want to stay in a noisy hostel dorm. Ask the groundskeeper named Moses about conch ceviche.

name: Tropical Education Center
description:
Update 03/03/23: NO RVs anymore; ONLY TENTS & CABANAS

Closest place to stay by the Belize Zoo. Good place to camp, brand new bathrooms with gigantic showers and covered picnic tables. Lots of people stay here in the cabins to do the night tour of the zoo. We went during the day and saw everything but the spider monkeys.  Electricity available only in the office.

name: The Trek Stop
description: A great place to stay before crossing into Guatemala. Very friendly owner. Has a big covered area with tables next to the kitchen with power and wifi. Feels and is safe. The butterfly house was interesting. Watch out for tarantula holes if you're pitching a tent.

name: Yellow-Green Vireo Campsite
description: A campsite near the lake at crooked tree bird sanctuary. Bathrooms and showers and a fire pit and some small palapas. Staff was friendly. 20 belize dollars per person.

name: Driftwood / Armadillo
description:
This camp site is at the north end of Hopkins Village, at the Armadillos restaurant. 

Driftwood resto are closed on Wednesdays (the day we showed up) but i asked a couple maintenance guys if we could camp ther and they said it would be fine. No facilities for us at all (restaurant wa closed) but the beach here is nce and you can use the bathrooms when the restaurant is open. Price is free. Showers are 2 Belize Dollars ( not available, see recent check in)

UPDATE: The position is now correct. 
Wifi is fast, so you can upload/download some movies or pictures overnight. (03.03.20)

name: The SHAK Beach Cafe
description: Great smoothies, shakes, and OJ. The jerk chicken sando I had was amazing as well.

name: Blue Hole National Park- caves entrance
description: They let us camp in the parking area for the national park. Primitive facilities but it was only $5 belize for camping. Entrance to the park (caves and blue hole and birds trail) is $8 belize ppers.

name: Nochuch Che'em Park
description: We went tubing through caves here and it wad really fun!!  They have a beautiful ruver and also some zip line nonsense

name: Farmers Trading Center
description: A great store for fresh veggies and fruit, but they have a ton of other stuff.  Lots of Menonite produce and meats for sale here. Good place to stock up.

name: Sisters Diner
description: We came for perogies and they thought we're German.  Giant burger w/fries for $16, chicken w/rice and beans for $10, hot dog $4, most expensive item in the menu is probably fried fish fillet for $20.25.

name: Rio On Pools
description:
6/23. Camping is permitted.
.....
Camping is not allowed here anymore, even with permit. We were kicked out by the military then tried to get permits in San Ignacio and were told camping is not allowed here.

name: Mana Kai
description:
Cabanas and camping. This is near central San Ignacio, so you can walk into town from the campsite. There is wifi, a kitchen area, bathrooms, a big grassy field and a large palapa with hammocks. 
 Nice, clean, well-tended campground with warm shower, kitchen, cabanas, great WiFi and electricity. BZD 20 per person per night as of 22/1/2024.

name: Old Belize Marina / Cucumber Beach
description:
At the marina you can camp. You have WIFI, water, shower, toilet. There is often a mild to strong breeze, so it was the two days here, very cozy! Very quiet and very safe. cheap place. 35.95 bzd for 25” and longer rigs 16.95 bzd for shorter ones. 3.50 for the laundry token
5 BLZ / night to park the van if you want to take the water taxi to Caye Caulker.

name: Eco-Tours boat ramp
description: at the boat launch of Eco-Tours in Orange Walk.  Price: Free when booked boat trip to Lamanai ($ 50 pp).

name: Altun Ha Ruine - OK, FREE
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! confidence scams reported in this location. Please use caution.

One can in the parking lot of the ruins, not camp, but after questions we were told, we can next to make exactly this GPS point. Since few other cars were already parked. Here it was very quiet. FREE!  Price: Free

name: Augustine / Douglas d’Silva
description:
Cute FREE campsite on the way to Caracol.
Covered picnic areas, toilets and showers. Was super quiet and nice and cool at night.  Price: Free

You must get a permit from the forestry office in San Ignacio or Belmopan to stay there. The guards will be notified and will cleanup the place before you arrive.

Note, the water always works but they turn it off at the stopcock on the outside of the rightmost washroom outhouse. Turn the red tap for water.

name: Baboon Sanctuary
description: A howler monkey reserve with a rare kind of howler monkeys. One can here make Hikes to the howler monkeys (7US $ / person), or even go on a crocodile tour. You can overnight next to the Visitor Center for $ 5B / person. (Now 10 us Dollar per vehicle) WC and showers. Power would be an extra $ 5B. Has just a bit of shade, especially afternoon. But had a nice breeze. Was quiet at night.Note 12/21/2017: there is a place right behind the sanctuary office that rents cabanas and accomodates small campers ,which I added as a separate entry.

name: Beim Fluss - ?, FREE
description: Seen when passing. Has a place right on the river where you could stay safe. Have we not been tested. If for FREE!  Price: Free

name: Lamanai Ruinen - NO CAMPING
description:
ADMIN NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals. 
Beautiful Mayan ruin, one of our best sites, sleep in the village and come to happiness. Not a cat before 12 pm Howler monkeys and spiders, parakeets and other species are walking here. top.
10 belize dollars per adult and children over 5 years old

name: Nohoch Che'en Cave - ?
description: We have not slept here, we were only at the cave tubing trip (from 25US $ / person if you book a guide on the spot. Fryjack The guide we found good), but you have gessagt us, you can sleep there. Rates & what they want should be clarified! You have to either come early or in the evening, as the day full of tourists are, especially if the Cruise Ships are here!

name: Lorraine's Guest House
description: Bungalow style with ensuite bathroom, two double beds.  Clean bathroom, hot showers, fast wifi, pool table.    Price: Bungalows are 50B/night for two people with 20B/person for each extra person.

name: Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary
description:
Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary is also referred to as The Jaguar Sanctuary because there are several jaguars in the area. This is a wildlife park with some basic camping facilities. The area for vehicle camping is actually the halicopter landing area, so we were told not to park in the middle. Should be room for four to five small campers. Good starting pint for jungle treks, with or without guide.   
Price: 20 belize $ Entrance fee you pay only once (10bz pp). Camping is 20bz pp per night.Cabanas starts from 40bz and tubing is 15bz pp.

name: Victors Inn
description: A run down place that looks like it used to have everything. There is a restaurant up front, and some cabañas/rooms for rent. In the back there is a large field with the remains of hook up stations (and a car wreck or two..). Water is still running, but no electricity. They opened a room for us so we could use toilet and shower. We had the whole place to our selves (a few locals came by the restaurant for some drinks) the night we were there. Not particularly nice and quite expencive, but if you need a place to park for the night...   Price: 20 belize $

name: Corozal Beach
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because camping is illegal here.  Signs posted and enforced

name: Hummmingbird Haven
description: Emergency to stay overnight. In fine weather, you can put yourself in the lawns. Toilets and showers available. . Quiet     night B $ 30, -. Much too expensive.  Hummingbird Hwy aParking lotroximately in the middle. The property is well signposted.

name: Future Eisenwarenfabrik
description: Good to stay overnight, water. Very quiet.  Free  Road to Spanish Lookout

name: Ruby's
description: This is a good and cheap(er) place to stay if you want to enjoy the reefs without going to Key Caulker. We paid 37 USD (couple) for a clean room with a fan and private bathroom right on the beach and it was adjacent to the diving tour agent. Sharks, manta rays, turtles, stingrays, eels and barracuda were all too close within a 2.5 hour boat trip that costs 50 USD per person. It makes sense if you don't want to go to Belize City. Boats run straight from Corozal.

name: Midway Hardware
description: The Spanish Lookout in general and Midway Hardware in specific is a great place to buy products in western standards including camping equipment to electronics. We came looking for tent waterproofing spray and they had more than a few options. Some of these stores have better choices than what we're used to in California. It's quite a shock to experience such an isolated level of "development". In short, if you thonk there's anything you should've brought but did not, you'll probably find it here.

name: Country Park
description:
This is an amazing location overlooking a small lake in the community park. There is an enormous covered, cement ground structure with electrical outlets on every pole and water faucets. It's so big, you could fit nine Cessna planes inside. 
If there are no community events happening during your visit, they may let you in as well.

name: Camping
description:
- 10 BZD per person
- owner was not very welcoming
- flushing toilet and shower, not very nice, but the toilet has a padded seat! (it is probably used by the family living here)
- no beach camping, you have to walk to the beach (but it was littered with trash)
- All in all, not a good place, but we arrived after sunset and we did not have enough energy to look for anything else. We'd suggest just boondocking in the village - the streets go all the way to the sea. Don't go south of the village, it is all private property and you won't get to the beach.
- Road to hopkins village is being paved, but it was ok when we were there. Some back roads were flooded though.

name: Thong's Cafe
description: Excellent omelet and good conch soup. Good portions. Open 7am to 3pm. Decent prices, not cheap but worth it. Soup and bread USD6 and Italian omelet with cheese and bacon USD8

name: Miramar Apartments
description: Room for one cab over camper. They let us park near their entrance and plug in for $25 Belize/night. Speak with Elsa the manager in the office open from 8:30-5 mon-fri. Oscar is the grounds keeper and lives above the laundry, very helpful as well. Right in the center of Placencia and walking distance to all the bars and restaurants.

name: agua filtrante
description: Sells 5 gallon blue jugs of purified water. Or you can bring in your own jug and they fill it directly. Charged us $2BZ to fill our 5 gallon jug (Nov 2014). Open 8am - 5pm, unsure about weekends.

name: Hickatee Inn
description: We stayed in a cabana when we visited PG prior to our overlanding trip. But Ian, the owner, mentioned that he would let people camp in the yard behind the hotel.

name: Julio's Shop
description: Julio did a great job on some emergency frame repair for us. Included dropping the gas tank and welding on some new parts. Ask around town for Julio, or speak with Natalie at Backpacker's Paradise.

name: Public parking lot
description: Public parking lot near a police station. Directly in placencia, some bars, restaurants and shops around.

name: Hokey Pokey Ferry Terminal
description: Here you get fresh water for 0.10 Belice/gallon- staff are unsure if it is potable/drinking water from the spigot but can sell you drinking water from 5 gallon jugs.

name: Shane's Camp Site
description: Shane is a very eloquent and informative Rastafarian with his own slant on life. His family own a large area of Forest the the camp site is in the middle of that has it's own resident howler monkey family. On day two the family came into the camp site to play in the trees and across the ladders Shane has erected between the trees. No running water whilst we were there but running water was connected outside the house the day we left and Shane is committed to having showers available within the next week or so and wifi in the near future. Not so much a camp site as an experience and you must try grandmas tamales. $10us to camp, $10us each for the very informative monkey tour and$55us each for an evening crocodile tour including guide and canoe.

name: National Park Entry
description: Free park entry, but Guard wanted a donation. Military convoy to Caracol is 13 miles further.

name: Turn To 1000ft Waterfall
description: Must turn here (4wd high clearance only)

name: Bird's Eye View
description: BZ$20/person. The Green Yellow campgrounds were closed  because of too much rain. Verna, one of the family owners at bird's Eye, provided us with a parking spot and access to the hotel's bathrooms.Flush toilets, very clean. We did not ask about a shower. The food at the restaurant was very good. You need to tell them ahead of time if you would like to eat there. We enjoyed the bird watching boat tour with their guides

name: Kismet Inn
description: Best spot to stay in Hopkins whether you are camping, in a RV, or want to find a nice affordable room for a change. You are right on the beach and the owner, Trisha, not only is extremely welcoming and values her guests from all over the world, but is knowledgeable and gladly provides information about the area, tours, culture, and best places to eat. However, there is no need to travel far because she is an exceptional Cook and uses freshly caught fish from the sea (you have to try her famous dish - lobster with "crack" butter - because you want more - and fresh baked bread) and has access to the best produce in the village (because she is vegetarian friendly). Also, you can use her free bikes, wifi, and bathroom and showers are available and clean. 10BZ per person and the best rate you can find.

name: Shell Gas Station
description: It's hard to find a safe camping spot within Belize City. After getting turned down to camp at a few spots around town we asked this Shell station and they were incredibly friendly. Offered their big parking lot without hesitation. There's a nice security officer on duty 24/7

name: On The Cove
description: Quiet spot that's right on the water after a long and muddy road. Didn't see anyone else while we were here

name: Mariposa Restaurant and Beach Suites
description: its 45 US $, no matter if 1 or 2 persons + 20 US$ per child

name: Ristorante Amigo's
description: Free in the parking of the restaurant, relaxed atmosphere and good prices

name: Jacana Inn
description:
10$ Belize per night per person. We parked our van on the grass beside the hotel, directly on the shore of the lake. They gave us access to the bathroom of a hotel room. Very nice place and friendly owner.
Hotel is well-signed when you enter Crooked Tree village.

name: Big Falls Adventure
description: Great location near ruins sites, chocolate farms, and Punta Gorda. Plenty of room to camp along side the river under the bridge. Bathrooms/showers (cold) onsite. Restaurant and zipline avsailable

name: Clarissa Falls Resort
description: Pretty resort with camping, cabanas and a restaurant. Located on river with great swimming and a waterfall. Price is 16,35 Belize per person per night. Internet is only available at the restaurant (not at the campsites). Campsites are fairly level and have a picnic table and grill.

name: Ignacio's
description: Cabañas on stilts right by the water. Nice breeze, great view. 50-100 BZ a night depending on room. Private bathrooms and showers.  Kitchens in some rooms.

name: Palmeto Grove
description: Nice grassy area with power near the stage not at sites. Clean bathrooms. Good food at restaurant. Also has cabañas. Tours and kayaks available. Water access to the lagoon from site.  $10 bz per person. $5 bz to plug in.

name: One World Rentals
description: Very nice rooms with kitchenettes and private baths. Air con if you want it, cheaper if not. 107 $BZ for two people. Ample parking for smaller rigs (Volkswagens, pickups etc). A great break from the road and not any campgrounds nearby.

name: Chechum Ha cave
description: We paid 20 blz per night for two of us to camp near there creek toilet with no door and on the second night needed to bucket water from the creek to flush toilet bath In the creek all really fine as it was safe but more like boondocking Leah our host made sure that we were fine each afternoon her son William showed us through the jungle and to the Mayan cave his dog and he discovered in 1989 cost 50 blz per person the 8 mile journey was very rough and often in4wd but any vehicle with high clearance should be able to pass we loved it be it somewhat expensive Later on our return to San Ignacio we hearts that bandits have been reported on the road in the past however we felt safe

name: Parking Marina Radisson Hotel
description: Free parking lot in front of the sea, right behind the Radisson Hotel. There is a security guard 24/7 from the hotel and said it was safe to stay here. We stayed two nights and it was quiet and nice, with a cold breeze from the ocean. You  can get wifi from the hotel.

name: Parking Lot Next to Radisson Hotel
description:
Parking on the street close to the Radisson hotel with a security spot. Quiet, in front of the sea. Feels safe. Free!! 
.....
Estacionamiento en la calle al lado del hotel Radisson. Hay un puesto de seguridad, un lugar tranquilo y frente al mar. Se siente seguro. Gratis!

name: Mike's Place
description: The is a place where you can zipline, canoe a cave, eat at a restaurant, and camp. You can pitch a tent or park and use your roof top tent or self contained camper for $10US per night. Mike and other staff pretty friendly. Internet, but it is satellite based so he asks you don't do video on it. Satellite TV if you are interested. The road is doable, but very challenging in a small 2wd vehicle - recommend high clearance and 4wd.

name: Free Parking Lot on San Ignacio Riverside
description: Free!!! Kind of parking lot in front of San Ignacio market, on the river side, just after cross the bridge. No facilities, local people said us it was safe to Park overnight. Close to Guatemala border /// Gratis!! Una especie de estacionamiento enfrente del mercado de San Ignacio, al lado del río, justo pasando el puente. Sin servicios, pero la gente local nos dijo q era seguro pasar la noche ahí y es cerca de la frontera con Guatemala.

name: Ds Hostel Backpacker
description: We stayed 3 nights in this backpacker hostel. There is a very good ambient. the breakfast ils amazing. You can park your car / van or whatever in front of without pb. We slept in a dorm for 27 bz per person. enjoy

name: Lamanai Riverside Retreat
description:
Nice grassy area directly at the river, next to the restaurant. Camping and cabanas. Friendly owners Clean toilets and basic cold shower.
(Dec 2021 no shower) 
(April 2022 there’s showers but dirty and messy)
Gates are closed at night and there is a night guard. 30 belize dollar p/p for camping, 90belize dollar for a cabana and 30 Belize for a truck. 
(April 2022 Electricity hookup availible included in the 30 BZ per night). 
Charging electric devices at restaurant bar is free. Wifi, boat tours to Lamanai ruins, restaurant, laundry services 
(Dec 2021 no laundry). 

Update 09/02/2023 25$bz/person

name: Tropical Paradise Hotel - NICE
description: Nice Hotel at the waterfront. Bungalow style with hot showers, A/C, fast wifi, basic Rooms, very friendly staff. Different categories available from 60 BZ to 130BZ (US 30-65$) for two People. Watertaxi 4 minutes walking distance as well as Bars, Restaurants, supermarkets. Water Taxi Costs 50BZ round trip. Return ticket is valid for 3 months. Takes 45 minutes from Belize City and 30 minutes to San Pedro.

name: Pickled Parrot
description: Great bar and restaurant with daily dinner specials for 10 Belize $ Owners are very friendly and can help with advice with accommodation, full of colorful characters and good stories- a warm greeting for bikers

name: Sunview Hotel
description: Nice budget place for 50bz for a room with fan, TV, secure parking, decent WiFi and friendly owner. Cheapest place we could find in town!

name: Plage De Dangriga
description:
Free Parking

Parking gratuit bord de mer tranquille

name: Joseph On The Beach
description: A few hundred meters from this point further to the coast lives a man, Joseph, in a little cabana. He is happy to receive people for camping or hiring a room. Totally isolated. His neighbour is a fisherman and happy to sell you fresh catch.

name: Bella Sombra Guesthouse
description: The secure parking next to the guesthouse is available for camping in a quiet area of town. Bathrooms and hot showers available. Wifi works on sites. I paid USD 10 for 1 person and car a night. Very friendly staff. You can also park your car here if you are going out to the islands Cay Caulker or San Pedro. (Tropic Air field is around the corner and boat is 30 minutes walk away). They can be contacted by email or phone. Bellakingspark@gmail.com. +501 6318989. Address: 1 Saint Markstreet. They have another site on 36 Hydes Lane.

name: GJ's Restaurant
description: Informal camping in parking lot of GJ's Restaurant. Right on side of the road. Exposed. You can be seen from the road. We only camped here because we were a group of 4 vehicles. Loud at night. Restrooms, no showers. 10BZD per vehicle ($5USD) or if you patronize the Restaurant you can camp for FREE.

name: Funky Dodo
description: great backpacker hostel.  24.50bzd for a dorm. 57bzd for a private. pet friendly if you have a private room. secure parking for bikes inside and street parking for trucks with security guard at night. welcoming and friendly owners who are happy to advise you on things to do in the district. 1 minute walk to beach

name: Hotel Ocean Paradise
description: This is for who want to dive or snorkel Great Blue Hole. We drove overland from Mexico border town Chetumel to orange walk town and finally Belize City. We were planning to stay there and take ferry next day but somehow didn't enjoy the vibe and took ferry same day after parking in a by side road parking lot ( gated and paid $5 per night). Took 5 pm ferry to San Pedro , got here around 7pm. Walked around and found this hotel. Clean room, shower, a/c, close to beach, night clubs (so little. Noisy) and dive agents. Signed to go diving blue hole next day 5.30 am start so being close helped.

name: Ixcacao Maya Belizean Chocolate
description: Great place to learn about chocolate, plants & processing & etc. Juan, the owner, is very friendly and let us camp on his farm just a mile away in the middle of the jungle. He called it his personal 'Walmart' and showed us all the herbs, roots and fruits which we were free to use for dinner. Great atmosphere at night when the monkeys started to howl. Camping is free, but we booked the 2-hour tour for next day. It's a family-run business and while Juan leads you through the chocolate-making process his wife prepares a Mayan lunch (tour & lunch for 35$ US).

name: Cabo's
description: cabo's is a gaz station hotel restaurant shop. we ask to the restaurant to stay overnight. It was possible on the sides or behind the restaurant. was very quiet between 10pm until 6.30am. wifi available but we haven't ask for pwd.

name: Customs Belize Port - Parking
description: Free and secure parking when going to the Cayes

name: Western Dairies
description: It has one of the best Ice creams I have tasted. It has very good economic food as well. A plate of eggs beans and fried jack is only $3.75 Bz. (a Belizean dish) its a very clean facility. And its open Monday to Saturday from 7:00 am to 5:00pm and Friday and Saturday its open until 8:pm.

name: Small Airport. On The Street.
description: We parked here for two nights. We felt very safe. Free wifi from the Maya Air. We found water in the street close where we parked. From here you can take fligths to see the Blue Hole. USD 425,00 for 3 person and 1:30h flight. Bathrooms inside the building.

name: LPGas
description: LPG, propane refill for our fix tank on the camper. we paid 10$BZ for around 3 Gallons

name: Eco Adventures
description:
Free overnight parking when you do the trip to Lamanai ( 80 BZD / person)
They have wifi and you can fill up your tank.
the boat ride was really nice with monkeys, birds and crocodiles. the ruins are worth a visit too.

tour starts around 9 am and lasts for 5 hours

name: sea n sun
description: nice guesthouse, paid 109 bzd for private room with private bath. shared bath also avaiable. free use of kajak and bikes. nice owners. you can also use the kitchen / fridge

name: Almond Tree Hotel Resort
description: We asked if we could park in the lot across from the hotel.  Woman agreed and said we could use the hotel pool which is clean and very well kept.  no services but there is a bar/restaurant in hotel.  Paid 20bzd for two people and a rig.  we were two couples and two trucks.

name: Sarteneja beachfront
description: We were told by both the police and a local realtor, that the beach front is mostly federal land here and as long as you did not park where someone might own the area 6metres from the water, you were good.  we camped here, two rigs, four people for a night.  there are public bathrooms across the street open during daylight and a nice long pier a very short walk away to swim from.  water is mucky near the shore and still quite shallow off the pier.  There are bars and restaurants nearby, some with wifi.

name: Bocawina
description:
This is private land with lodging + restaurant where prices are between $16 USD - $20 USD, Bier 3USD + zipline and waterfall rappeling. The land is in Mayflower national park entrance is $10 BZD. I don't know how much lodging is but I was talking to the operator and he said they allow camping free. Even if yiu do not stay trails around are worth hiking.

WiFi pwd for bocawinaguest: bocamama2018

outdoor showers available

name: Barefoot Beach
description: hotel with cabins on the beach.  we took a "hut" at the back for $55 usd with AC and a cooler.  Huts are pretty new, clean and quiet.  There is  good Wi-Fi.  Owner, Susan, very nice and helpful.  nice dock on the water with chairs  and hammocks under a palapa. We took two tours: Blackhawk tours to Hold Chan - $60US for six hours on a sail boat and a flight over Blue Hole thru Anda da Water tours - $190US pp with Caribe Air - highly recommend.

name: Savannah Bed and breakfast
description: This is a bed and breakfast. I found when looking for a place. $66 USD per night

name: Downtown Plaza
description: secure parking lot with 24/7 guard.  Paid 20bzd for 24 hrs while we went to the Cayes for a week.  enter lot off Bishop street; it's a one way heading the correct direction off Albert St.

name: By the River
description:
WARING FLASH FLOODS HAPPENS HERE! DO NOT CAMP OR OVERNIGHT. 

Do NOT camp at this location in the rainy season (June-Nov)! We made the mistake of doing so and our rig was washed away in the middle of the night. Water rose about 1 foot within a few minutes, very scary! We are lucky we woke up and noticed it and got out on time, but our trip had to be ended because of it. We could tow our car out when the water went back down the next day, but all our interior and many possessions were damaged. Be very careful and ask the locals if you're not sure. If we had asked, they would have told us camping here was a stupid idea.

name: Rio Frio Cave
description: They tell you in San Ignacio you need 4x4 and that the road is in bad shape but we took it and did not need high clearance or to use 4x4.  a couple a rough spots but totally doable.  better than the Coastal Highway.  if you use maps.me don't follow her directions but rather follow directions to Caracol then at Douglas field station, keep right instead of left and follow the signs.  we did not camp here but you probably could in your rig in parking lot or in a tent next to the river.  there is a pit toilet and picnic tables. nice attraction.

name: Caracol Ruins
description: It's a long drive in but the road is in decent shape. The last 15 to 20ish km are paved. There is a military escort that leaves at 9am and returns at 2pm but you are not required or needed to travel with them just make sure to get in early as they don't like to let people in past the checkpoint after 12ish. The cost for the ruins is only 15 BZD, even know people online and lonely planet say it's 30 BZD. It is well worth the drive and the price as it is a very large site with many excavated ruins that you can climb. As well as a few tombs that you can go into. The ruins is set in the jungle with howler monkeys and lots of other wildlife. The gps is about 2 km off as we logged it on our way out.

name: Security Check Point
description: Security check point where you have to sign in and out going to caracol ruins. The military escort leaves at 9 am and returns at 2 pm from caracol ruins but you are not required or needed to travel with them just make sure to get in early as they don't like to let people in past the checkpoint after 12ish.

name: Big Rock Falls
description: Waterfall and a nice place to swim. From the parking lot it's about 400 m walk down to the water. Could camp overnight at the parking lot but no facilities and doesn't look nice, but it's free.

name: Near Altun Ha
description: Possible place to stay the night near Altun Ha. Big grassy place behind an empty building in the jungle. Many mosqitos, but very quiet. Slept there one night.

name: Laundry
description: "Washee Washee": nice and quick laundry service, 2B$/kg, in Orange Walk.

name: Sabal Cassava Bread Factory
description: $3 for that whole package of cassava, come and support local market. They also make ginger cassava biscuits and spicy. Baking on Tuesdays and this is the only day they accept visitors.

name: Marie Sharp Hot Sauce Factory
description:
Mmm delicious jams, jellies, hot sauces. Mrs Sharp's just entered the Hall of Fame in New York at age 75! Great prices. come check them out. 

Tour and tasting is $20 Bzd pp

name: The Country Barn
description: Delicious Frozen yogurt & ice cream. They sell milk, ricotta, sour cream, chocolate milk, cheese, iced coffee and ice cream (there is plantain flavor!). $4BZ for 2 scoops of ice cream

name: Queen Bean
description:
Local food restaurant. Good good food good tunes beach side. We came here for dinner then slept in the beachfront dirt lot. No charge, gave her 10B to plug in my fridge cooler.

Update: Now 20 BLZ.

name: Near Corozal At The Sea
description: Grassy spot at seafront behind a palappa, no neighbours. Stayed there one night. Tents could be set up, but maybe get wet from the sea if it is windy.

name: Sibun River - 30 km east Belmopan
description:
Beautiful place at river. Nice to swim there, also good to stop if you don't want to stay over night. 
From the main road you have to turn where the sign for "Monkey bay lodge" (you can camp there too) is. Then 10min drive on gravel road, last meters maybe a bit narrow for big rigs, but you also can park on a grassy field.

name: Enrique's Beach Restaurant Bar
description: Probably camping is possible if the owner is around. He wasn't there and restaurant closed. Luckily could stay at the lodges from the neighbor.

name: Mangos Restaurant
description: Great place to stop in and get a few drinks and dinner. Menu is priced for all budget types. They have a $12 bz special available from 3-5 pm that is the best deal you will find in the area. They also have a kids menu starting at $8 bz! They kiddos enjoyed coloring the kids menu as well as playing on the beach. They have beach chairs and draft beer! Happy hour food and drink specials from 3-5pm drafts for $5 bz, local rum for $4, homemade bitters shots for $1!

name: Mayflower Bocawina National Park
description:
At the entrance of the national park you can camp in a grassy area with one palapa, picknick tables and hammocks. There are flush toilets both inside and outside of the visitor centre, the later open at night. There is an outside shower with a questionable curtain, we did not use it. Very quiet at night apart from the regular jungle sounds. Security guard present at night.
If you hike the Antelope Trail, leave very early because it is hot and heavy. Wonderful pool at the top, good for skinny dipping.
Entrance National Park BZ$ 10 per person, camping BZ$ 10 for 2 persons and a van.

Adding: there is wifi at the restaurant if you want to have a beverage. Meals were in USD aka pricey.

name: Land Rover scrapyard
description: Lots of different cars but many scrap land rovers, including the defender. If you're struggling for parts, might come across something here.

name: Land Rover Belize Ltd.
description: Land Rover parts including Defender. Not visited yet but will update when we've checked the place out!

name: Xunatunich
description: "Ferry" across the river to ruins. they asked for a tip on the way there but not back. Ruins allow dogs -as all ruins in Belize do.  Keep them leashed, under control and clean up after them! No charge for ferry.

name: Au French Corner
description: Savory and sweet crepes, breakfast, and lunch. Free coffee refills (a hard thing to find on the island)! Owned by a wonderful Canadian couple who recently bought the place from the French originator. Scrambled egg dishes starting at 5BZ, crepes start at 12BZ, everything is made onsite and is fresh. Open Mon, Wed-Sat 8am-1pm and Sun 10am-1pm, closed Tue.

name: Cafe Casita De Amor
description: Eggs or omelet with toast for around $10BZ, scrambled eggs with chaya was delicious! Also serve coffee, juice, crepes, etc. Today's menu also listed ice cream ($5), burgers ($10), spaghetti with meatballs ($14), and rice with beans ($12). Open daily 7:30-5:30.

name: Ko-Ox-Han-Nah Restaurant
description:
Recommended by a local and so happy he did. Everything our group ordered was SO flavorful and well prepared. Pork Tacos, lamb burger, stewed chicken, vegetable soup, pulled pork sandwich and even the complimentary chips and salsa....awesome! Prices were very reasonable and service excellent. Would highly recommend. They're known for their lamb dishes and curries but everything was great! 
Fabulous food! Indian, Thai, Belizian - all really good. Prices vary fro $6-28 BZ.

name: San Ignacio Resort Green Iguana Project
description: Walkable from the Mana Kai if you're camping there.  this is worth a stop for the iguanas!! The Green Iguana Project is housed behind the hotel. Pay at the front desk ($18Bzd pp) and join a tour at the top of the hour. Eat some termites. Hold some iguanas. It’s awesome fun!

name: Spice Farm and Restaurant
description: Spice Farm and Restaurant offers tours of the spice farm, meals, and spices/honey for sale; East Indian primarily. We had delicious breakfast here, paid $10BZ for eggs, bacon, sausage, sautéed vegetable, fruit, and Indian tortilla. Lotus flowers were in bloom so we had a couple of those also. Large glass of fresh juice for $2BZ. We didn't take a tour, but price was listed as $20BZ per person. Very friendly ppl.

name: Mickey's Snack Shop
description:
Edit 2022: Still cheap and good fast food, but no Indian Taco's anymore. 

Cheap local food.  Order an Indian Taco and thank me later.  It's not anything that we would recognize as Indian food and it's not really a taco. It's a fry jack covered in beans, shredded chicken, cabbage, tomatoes, bacon, cheese, sour cream and red and green salsa. Soooooo good!

name: Running W Meats
description: Factory prices on fresh and processed meats. Open M-F 8-4:30, Sat 8-1.

name: BTL/buy phone SIM card
description: Belizean Telemedia Limited. Buy Digicell SIM card. 22 Belizean dollars. Need passport and address in Belize because number has to be registered

name: Water Taxi to Ambergris Caye
description:
Water Taxi to San Pedro, Ambergris Caye. 

Departs everyday at 7:30AM for 50BLZ (one way) a person. Backpackers Paradise has offered to watch the vehicle for 10BLZ a night. Safer location than in Belize City in my opinion. 1.5hr ride. Return taxi departs San Pedro at 3pm.

name: Water Taxi to Sarteneja
description: Departs everyday at 3PM. 50BLZ per person, one way. get there early

name: GT Glass Technology
description: If you need to repair your windscreen, this is the place! Big Joe will do it competent and quickly.

name: Aqua Lite
description:
For 30L it cost us BZ $3.50.
No hose possible

name: balloon pizzeria
description: A ocean front restaurant near the ferry terminal for Caye Caulker. we camped here one night and then left our vehicle there for 5 nights when going out to the cayes. they had a nice big parking lot and let us camp and use the bathrooms, security guard all night- felt very safe. they didn't charge us anything and let us use bathrooms and WiFi. On Dec 6th 2016 we paid 8$ per car/day

name: Beach front (free public park)
description:
In front of a small blue pavilion on a grassy pit next to the sea. It belongs to a hotel (green) across the street. We asked them and they had no problems parking us here.
Locals said if they would mind we should park 5 meters further inside the public park (soccer field).

Great breeze, no bugs, 3 meters from the sea. Very quiet and safe.

name: Guava Limb Cafe
description: This restaurant is fantastic. they have some of the best food we've had in Belize, and the drinks are AMAZING. They are open every day except Monday.  Ask them for the cucumber gin fiz even if it's not listed on the menu. Shame not open for breakfast. They start lunches at 11:00hrs.

name: The great mayan prince
description:
Great food at any time during the day! Even if the place looks pricy it's cheaper and in our opinion also better than anything in the main street.
Great staff, very friendly. Fast WLAN. 

We tried the breakfast burrito (10 BZD) which was great and had a fish soup (whole fish in a coconut brew with potatoes and rice for 12 BZD) as well as a mayan sandwich for 10 BZD. Everything delicious and the beer is just 3.50 BZD.

name: Paw's Veterinarian
description: Great vet near the border to get health certificate for Guatemala. Very friendly and professional.

name: Silverline Parts
description: This place sells heavy duty big truck parts but they had a relay for our dual battery system - the owner, Omar is really helpful. He doesn't pretend to know anything that he doesn't.

name: Universal Hardware
description: Great hardware store - has little green propane tanks (expensive though, 14 bze each) and a ton of heavy duty tools, etc.

name: BTIA Tourist Info
description:
Tourist information shack. The BTIA is not a governmental organization, but they aren't trying to force tours down your throat or anything. Decent info on attractions in Punta Gorda and surrounding area. If they don't know the answer, they'll call around for you. 

Perhaps more importantly they have free wifi with a strong signal (connection is slowish but decent for Belize). Network: BTIA

name: Sun Creek Lodge
description:
Bed & Breakfast in the heart of the wild south of Belize, the Toledo District.
Paradise for outdoor and adventure traveller.

name: Eladio's Chocolate Farm
description:
Popular spot for cacao farm tours. Eladio started tours here about 30 years ago and has 15 children many of which help him carry on the tradition. 

We took the chocolate tour which was 50 BZD each, and were able to camp on their property for free overnight, with bathroom and shower access. Parking next to the red house was safe and flat.

name: Rio Blanco
description: River with waterfalls, hiking trails; 5 minute easy walk to waterfall. Water was a little high and fast moving because of rainy season so we didn't swim. Camping is allowed in tents down by the river or in the parking lot in a vehicle. Parking lot is dirt and gravel and is not level, almost no vehicle traffic between 9pm and 5am. BZ10 per person for entry and additional BZ10 per person for camping. Small gift shop next door.

name: Noh Sos Waterfall
description: Free waterfall and pools open to the public with large gravel and grass parking area right next to the highway. 3G signal, was able to make calls but not much internet connection.

name: Corozal
description: Free! Grassfield on the Bahia de Chetumal. Palmtrees for the shade . Next to the road to Orange Walk when you leave the city of Corozal. In the night it is quite . See breeze. The place is also a salespoint for 2hands cars  bud no one is coming to us. Nice place for free!

name: Ceiba Farm, Cayo, Belize
description: $10usd a night with an awesome expat herbalist named kim. Tent or vehicle. No wifi. Communal kitchen and bathroom.

name: Crooked Tree Lodge
description:
big parking space and lots of grassy area for tents. A few cabins as well. 20blz per van Outhouse with refreshing water at an astounding pressure! Stayed for 2 nights.
It about 8km of unpaved road from the highway to the campsite (30min).

reserve charges 4usd per person to enter

name: The Insurance Corporation of Belize
description:
Just right from the border entrance once you have entered Belize. Very helpful and friendly. Can pay by card (bring cash just in case as terminal does not always work). 
When we were here costs were $46BZD for 2 weeks or $29BZD for 1 week. We opted for two. Only liability cover - can't get full cover for short periods nor with a vehicle older than 5 years. Have offices in all cities if need to extend time of coverage. 
Remember 3rd party liability is mandatory in Belize :)

name: Heaven Valley Belize
description:
ADMIN NOTE: please be aware that this place has been submitted by a stakeholder of the place.

100 acres with serene mountain views, creek, ponds, monkeys, parrots and hiking.

Dry camping is currently available, with hookups coming. Washing water can be purchased for $1 for 5 gallons.  Drinking water, ice, groceries, etc. Are for sale next door except Saturdays.

name: Monkey Bay Wildlife Sanctuary
description:
Eco-tourism hotel/hostel/campground. Cold showers, WiFi, indoor seating/cooking area in a lovely setting. Space for big rigs as well as camping palapas for tents. They also offer breakfast and dinner, although these have to be booked in advance. There is also a drinking water tap, a welcome sight after months of filtering water by hand!

$10US per person per night for camping, so a little pricey by Belize standards.

name: Banana Bank Lodge
description: The Banana Bank Ranch is offering horse riding trips into the jungle. ($30USD p/p). We asked after a ride if we could stay overnight. This was no problem. They also serve family style diner. (15USD p/p). The premise is awesome, they have birds, parrots, etc. More than 100 horses live on the ranch. They have a great pool which is very well maintained. They probably only allow (free) camping if you either eat in the restaurant or if you do a horse trip. We enjoyed the place very much!

name: Beach Front II, quiet, free
description:
Level grassy spot right behind the beach, next to very quiet residential area. Nice spot, no/very little salt spray, no shade, no beautiful beach. Well lit at night but no other security measures.
Neighbour said it was quiet and he's never heard of any troubles to/with campers in the vicinity. Chinese shops in town got robbed (armed assaults) several times, including the one down the street. I felt safe.
Free.

name: Black Pearl Harley Davidson & bike storage
description: Really cool owners and besides that they can fix bikes they also offer bikers storage for their bikes while they visit Caye Culker Island.

name: Ocean Pearl Royale
description: Nice and one of the cheaper ones on Caye Caulker. Room with fan, two beds and private bathroom. We paid BZD 65 per night. There is Coffee and you can use the fridge. There might be warm/hot showers but I always shower vold when it's hot outside so cannot tell.

name: River Park Inn
description:
Update - now 35bzd to camp 

Simple established campground with clean washrooms and showers. Friendly staff. Wifi works but is average.   Grassy lot with flat spots.  Only $15 Belize which was cheapest we found.  Laundry available for $5/10 (small load/big load).

name: Rock Farm Guest House
description:
very Nice place for camping in belize.   10$us with hot shower electricity dumpstation wifi
you can See a lot of birds and hosts are very friendly ! 
possibility to have a room too but you need to go on the website.

name: Juice Valley manufacturing company
description:
Company store to buy fruit juice directly from the manufacturer 
- juice and Concentrate are 20-30% cheaper compared to any store

name: El Pelegrino
description: Hotel with double rooms and dorms. Simple but good value in a quiet street.

name: maya bella downtown hotel
description: this is a hotel located downtown with ample covered, secured parking and near banks, bus stop, market, gift shops, restaurants and local shops.  here you can interact with the locals and savor the different kinds of food of san Ignacio and central America. all our rooms have private bathrooms and fans.

name: Cheers Restaurant & Cabanas
description: Nice restaurant where you can camp with your rig for free. There are also cabanas. Internet and clean restrooms. No hookups.

name: Comfort Lodge
description: Nice, simple hotel with a communal kitchen. US$40+taxes per night (US$43). Kind owner, Tony, and tasty Indian food at their restaurant.

name: Kawasaki Dealer Belize
description:
Motor Solutions LTD

1804 Hummingbird Highway   Belmopan Cayo Dist. Belize C.A

Tel.: 501-822-0644 

http://www.motorsolutions.bz

name: D&A Hardware Store
description: Good selection of hardware items.  They are super friendly and they also sell home made cupcakes.

name: Window Tinting and Windshield Repair
description: House with covered drive way with big yellow hand-painted sign out front saying 'window tinting and window repair.' We took our truck there and got both windows tinted for 40BLZ. They also have a small blue shack out front with the best ceviche in town. Super friendly family owns it. Definitely a warm welcome into Belize from Mexico!

name: Freedom Star
description: Ran into owner while crossing ferry and he took us to the property. Free place to camp. Now just an open field that is partially cleared. Beautiful spot right on water. Owner, Kelly has plans to turn it into a hostel and camping area. He said he fine now with people camping here. Will eventually have water. Owner incredibly nice. We did not stay because we were headed to Sarteneja. Owners contact number is 5016000682.

name: Immigration Office
description: Renew tourist visa here. $50 Belizean for 30 more days. Longish line, but went fast. Large yellow building. Office is on the left after entrance. Must extend car permit at Customs office. Will also put location on iOverland

name: Hotel Mirador
description:
At first glance you cannot imagine that this big building could be a good opportunity for overlanders but it is. 
We found there the cheapest double room with ocean view in Corozal : 70BZD with a real safe private parking lot. 
Rooms are a little bit old (60's or 70's) but everything is clean and the young lady at staff is very friendly. 
The hotel Hok Ol K'in one hundred meters further charges 104BZD (+50%) without garage and without such a nice ocean view.

name: Anda Di House
description:
Bike Friendly. 
Cool hostel right on the beach. $25 Belize dollars. 
15 beds, 2 showers, stones throw from the beach. 
Directions: 
As you reach the end of Palencia Rd, turn left on Jewfish Rd. At the end, take (ride) the left walkway and follow it around to the right. Cross over the concrete sidewalk. Park inn front (facing the beach) of the house. Pandora (the owner) lives upstairs.

name: Mayflower Bocawina NP
description:
Excellent hiking in NP, all tracks start at park entrence (these coordinates show Big Drop Falls):
1) Antelope Track; 45min uphill, last bit steep with ropes, nice swimming.
2) Bird loop easy 45 loop thru jungle vegetation, not many birds seen.
3) the large waterfall loop (very little people do it); walk along the road for 35min to Bokawina falls (nice swimming), then another 1:45 to Beck Falls (the small trail gets worser and worser, sometimes a bit tricky to find / if you loose the trail in a gully do NOT head up, try to stay in the gully). Beck Falls are maybe the nicest, excellent swimming. Then another 15min to Big Drop Waterfall turnoff (good trail). From this turnoff it is 20min on a extremely steep trail (ropes provided) to Big Drop Fall (swimming difficult). You have to descend 190 altimeters! 20min backtracking to the turnoff. From turnoff (good former logging trail) 1:35min to Park entrance. (On the way you can walk down to an old steam hoist, it is only 170mts). Total walking time: 4:50hrs

We recommend to hike the other way round because you start with the hard bit and finish with a swimm in Bojawina falls. If you do so start at the park entrence, take the trail between Maya structure (ruin) 2 and 3, after 200mts take the right trail (16.930802 -88.381976).

name: Western Farm House & Camping
description: One bedroom house on a 30 acre family farm.  Comes equipped with a semi furnished kitchen, a bathroom, a double bed, a standing fan, purified drinking water and kitchenware.  Chicken and pigs are also being raised on the farm along with a few crops. Riverfront is 100ft away from the house. Plenty of mountains and natural wildlife are also around.

name: SeeMore Adventures
description: Scuba Dive & Adventure shop.  Also a coffee shop with smoothies and cakes/cookies, bagels, yogurt & granola, and fruit.  Scuba, Snorkel and Fishing.  Super friendly staff and small, personalized place.  Stop in and adventure with Danny & Kat.

name: El Castillo Camping
description:
Pretty beach camping with bathrooms, tire swings, and palapa.  $10 belize per person. 

Bonus: you can stay in a converted house boat on the beach for 50belize/night./p

name: Sew Much Hemp
description: Bug repellent and soothing lotion.  Good for sun as well.  Visit woman in the bus.  Really nice camping beyond the bus, on the beach,  available.

name: Lamanai chocolate
description: Lamanai Chocolate delicious chocolate made right there.

name: Laman eco tours
description:
incredible place! why b cuz errol is so generous knowledgeable etc etc. u don't want to miss his guided tours n fishing! 
clean toilets w lids TP n water to wash hands etc.

name: Hydro Purified Water
description: Purificada. It was one BZD to fill our two 6 liter jugs.

name: Farmer's Market
description: Fresh veggies, fruits and meat. Best days are Thursday and SATURDAY.

name: Pro Solar
description:
Full service solar installer. Primarily for residential and commercial installations, but they carry a fair selection of controllers, panels, batteries, and other stuff.

Very knowledgeable and professional with fair prices.

Also- Lead engineer and CEO Marco Valle (marco.prosolar@gmail.com) is an overlander fan. He spent a few years in the states, camping and exploring the sierras. He loves rigs.

name: Lamanai Ruins
description: Since camping on the ruins parking is not allowed they directed us to this spot. Pass ruin entrance gate. Before the resort turn left into narrow and rough track down to lake. There is a nice and level parking with room for a few small rigs. This is public land therefore freely accessable.

name: Sun Creek Lodge
description: Amazing jungle lodge with 6 cabanas and awesome common area with hammocks, tables chairs, good wi fi, fans, bathroom and shower with parking and camping area with shade and lots of grass.  Water, drinks, beer and meals available.  Close enough to main road but very quiet and peaceful!  Electricity is available in common area and they can run and extension cord to camping area.  Owned by very welcoming German family.  German, English, Spanish speaking.  They have very friendly German shepherds on the property who are good with other dogs but you may have to ask and make sure your dogs are ok with them.  Price depends on what you need, very fair.

name: Free electricity
description: public space by the lagoon with electrical outlets

name: Soldier river
description: River with a small beach. I didn't camp here, just stopped for a swim, but would be a great spot for one night. Just before the bridge there is a small turn off to the river side.

name: Smiths Family Farm
description:
A simple camping and cabana site. Big grassy area for camping. Very simple cold showers. Nice enough womens toilet with flush and zink with water. Mens only pissoir! A little traffic along the road but nothing disturbing.
A little unsure about official price. When we showed up in the afternoon the guy in charge told us that if we didnt pitch a tent the whole family could spend the night for 5 US (10BZ). When we showed up at night the owner was there and he was obviously not happy about the price. He wanted 5 US for each of the adults and the children could go for free. Was very nice though and of course we should only pay the 5 US when that was the original agreement. I guess the real price is 5 US (10 BZ) pr person. Or maybe the owner just felt bad that 3 older children camped for free and if I arrived as a couple I would ask for camping for 5 US in total. I think thats possible.

name: Fuel station
description: Small fuel station with market. Has BWEL propane for sale also. Says new management on sign and open every day.

name: Zona libre - Las Vegas casino hôtel
description:
Free on the  parking lot of Las Vegas Casino Resort. We asked permission to park one night before shopping in the Free zone the next day. They told us to park along the fence at the far left of the building. Casino close at 6am. Restrooms in Casino.
Restaurant and take away: medium size pizza (3 pers) for 7 USD.
Quiet  after departurs of commuters buses.

name: Dangriga Y-Not Island- Free
description:
You enter here by a little bridge with an open gate. This is a recreational area with grass field, coconut trees along the sandy seashore, a basketball court with light, a little dock along the river where locals swim when sea is too wavy and a drums workshop. It's very quiet. When it's breezy you won't be borrowed with sand flies otherwise buy a ventilator in one of the village shops. 
The restrooms near the basketball court were closed.

name: Corozal
description: I spent 11  days in the area Feb/17 and never had/felt  a problem. However within 4-6 weeks (April/May), 2 couples in vehicles were murdered in the Corozal area.  One of them being my friend.  Happened at night. I will leave it at that

name: Cotton Tree Chocolate factory
description: Free tour and very delicious chocolate to taste and to buy.

name: Gales Point Manatee
description:
The nice lodge offers Manatee tours out in the lagoon. 
65US$ / 2people
Nancy is very nice and runs the Manatee Lodge. Overlanders welcome to stay at the lodge. This is not a campground.
Beautiful spot to hang out!!

name: Paradise next Spanish lookout ferry
description:
Great small and friendly place with nice sunset on Belize River. Overlander prices: 20 bz per night for a big rig with 2 adults + 1 teenager. Basics shower and toilettes with bucket. 
River below, shadow, pic-nic tables, playground and swings for kids, 2 horses, good fried chicken with fries for 5bz ppers.
no drinking water but you can plug your hose to refill your tank.  
here you can  hike to Spanish lookout (the mennonites village) or visit the tilapia hatchery or swim during dry season.
3G BTL signal maybe wifi in a few weeks...

name: Jack Sparrow
description: Place right by river. Lots of place to park. Drive down road and it's on the left. A round wooden building. Two brothers own property, let us swim for the afternoon. Said they would take over landers. Have kitchen grill etc.

name: Parking Lot San Pedro Express
description: Official parking lot of the San Pedro Express ferry, we parked our van here for 3 nights during our stay at Caye Caulker. They charge 25 BZD per 24 h secure parking, but as we got back we found our car unlocked. Someone was inside, searched everything and stole - congratulations - a crappy vacuum cleaner. Luckily, all our real left valuables were hidden or stored in locked cupboards, and obviously there was not enough time to open them. The ferry company's reaction was sketchy, as there was no broken window or broken lock they tried to give us the blame. The police was friendly, they told about regular break-ins into cars in the harbour district using some kind of wires or hooks to unlock the doors. We got at least the parking fee back (with help of the police), but the company itself, especially the manager, was not really interested, there was no apology or something like "oh, we need to improve the security"... not recommended!

name: Tourist Info - Free map of Belize
description: You can have a free paper map of Belize in this Tourist Information.

name: Zeta Ice Factory - Purified Water
description:
Zeta Ice Factory is an ice factory that also do purified water.
1,5bzd/20L (garafon) if you want to fill it.
2,5bzd/20L if you buy a garafon already filled.
Place to park but busy street.

name: Sittee River Marina and Curve Bar
description: A great Marina on the Sittee River, which offers camping for RVs at $25BZD a night.  All facilities, 24 hour security and layback rental to explore the River.  Very pretty, very friendly, modern facilities and a mechanical engineer on site. Not sure about electricity at sites but it's a marina and has these dockside, so if you have an extension I'm sure you'll get hooked up.

name: Oceanfront south of Riversdale
description: Turn towards the ocean at these coordinates and there is a dirt road that will take you to a quiet secluded beachfront site

name: Maroon Creole Drum School
description: Jill and Emmeth run a drum school and fire hearth cooking.  They also allow campers. There's space for tents and one or two small campers.  Very welcoming, great little find in PG. ideal for motorcycles. Jill can cook food for you but not a formal - by arrangement.

name: Nuuk Cheil Cottages
description: We were unable to camp at the Wildlife sanctuary and found this place in Maya Centre. Aurora made us very welcome, she is also a Mayan Healer and does treatments for people.  There is a restaurant on site, we made Aurora aware we would eat as it was not busy at this time of year. Great little find. We paid 12 BZD pp to sleep in our van. There are bunk rooms and private rooms available.

name: Intranet Systems
description: Copies before the border, if needed. Left side of the street, going towards the border.

name: Tomza Gas
description: Good place to fill butane gas. They filled our Argentine bottle without issues. 8 Belize dollars for seven pounds.

name: British Shop
description: Next to the Landrover place a British Shop selling British Foods. Get your Yorkshire tea here!

name: Martha's Laundry
description:
Clean 14 bz dollars per load wash and dry. 
They are able to do it the same day if you drop off your stuff before midday.

name: Grants Laundry Service
description: Laundry and welding shop. In the blue house at the end of the road. $2 per pound of laundry. Fast and clean.

name: Placencia Hostel
description:
Nice hostel in the middle of town, one block from the ocean (as is everything in Placencia). They have dorms for 35bz and private rooms for 50bz a night. No AC, but fans and it cools down nicely at night. 
When we were there another overlanding couple was sleeping in their vehicle in front of the hostel and used the shower, but I don't know what they paid. There's a screened common room with coffee and free drinking water, a kitchen with sink and stove was just put in when we were there. The rooms were clean and the showers are even hot! Chris owner, is very accommodating, we felt welcome.

name: Julio and Family
description: Julio , Marisol,and family were kind enough to takes us in for the night, after a mechanical failure just after the border. It was dark, 1st time in Belize so not familiar with roads, we were tired cranky hungry and hot after 10 hours watching our truck get welded. We stopped at a small groceries store and asked to park, the family next door would have none of that- they had us park in the rear yard gave us power, a map, offered water for our tank and then even brought out a lovely snack.  Julio let us know that travelers are welcome! He also said he could arrange an area for large groups at the local football field !  There is a nice grassy area beside and behind his house to camp!. It is very safe and secure. The store next door is well socked and the owners are very nice !

name: Dirt road out of Riversdale village
description:
Follow the dirt road out of Riversdale along the water. There are a few pullouts right next to the ocean. Our VW bus fit snug, but no place for big rigs. Quite a bit of trash on the beach, like everywhere.
There is a new luxury housing development right south of this spot, cutting off the road. The other campspot south of this one doesn't exist any more, and it's hard to say if this one will once the mansions are complete.
Should have cell service, there's a tower in sight.

name: The Mall, Supermarket
description: This is what we found was closest to a normal Supermarket in the area, Fruit ,Veg, Dry goods, beverages

name: The Jungle
description: Big Parking lot across the street tourist village, were cruise ships arrive. Excellent music bar and small kiosk with spicy wings. Ask for Amir, nice guy, the owner. 24 hour security.

name: Very Kind Mechanics
description: These people helped us get things cleaned up after our car got caught nearby in a flash flood. Carlos (the owner) and his nephew (Thomas) we're very very kind and helpful in our time of need. They let us park our car there for over a week as we cleaned everything up and hung their shop full of laundry. Their employees all took turns scrubbing the mud off our car and trying to get the engine to run again, so persistent and unendingly helpful! If you need some help, go to these guys!

name: Jaguar morning star
description: Great place to stay, clean, cheap and calm. They got full unit and a cabana. Our git a full kitchen with fridge, stove and think, in perfect condition. the bed have real matress, not foam! it's new and clean,very quiet, perfect for relaxing... we could use the kayak for a trip around the caye.

name: Cuellos distillery tour
description:
nice distillery with a small archeological site behind the distillery.
you have to ask permission where the pin is located to be allowed a tour at the distillery. this is 7mins west from Orange walk by car.
the tour is free and the gut that gave the tour worked there for 22 years.
definitely worth going if you are interested in rum

name: Belize caving expeditions
description:
tour operator that can give really good deals on tours like caracole and atm caves.
we did the atm at the low season price. you can negotiate with Rudy.
the tour was at least as good as the other we saw at the caves. 
Éric was our guide and had us do a part of atm without lights and took us grouch some small rapids that other groups just walked around

name: Hopkins, Organic Farm Shop
description: organic farm shop run by a couple from the UK. the owners father has a farm near hopkins. They raise their own pigs (many cuts including some susages and even brawn) local chocolate produce, fruit drinks, frozen concentrated, and some european style breads / small selection pastry (Thursdays). New enterprise 2017, adding  new lines worth a look

name: Red Bank Cal's Mayan Pride Cafe
description:
We had a tour to the scarlet macaws with Raul and could stay overnight on the property of his family. The tour is 50US$ (not per person, it is the lump sum per group). The camping was free.  If needed electricity can be provided. Internet is available in an Internet Cafe not far from this place. Friendly and welcoming people. It is best to contact Raul in advance to make sure he is there. 

Raul's mail: tecraul22@gmail.com

The season for the macaws typically is from beginning of december til march/april.

name: Golden village Hotel
description: Hotel is very clean, wifi, 2 Double bed s per room, 55 US $ Rate for 2 People , 3 Min to The Airport and 10 to Belize City, Parking is 24 Hours Security , ac, Breakfast included, Restaurants, Gas Station and supermarket on The other side of The Street

name: Belmopan Tiny Houses Campgrounds
description: The Belmopan Tiny Houses and campgrounds is a quality and affordable accommodations and camping areas where adventure travelers enjoy the lovely forest environment, and amenities.  The campgrounds has camping spaces on ground, outside open air enclosed bathroom with plumbing and fire pit.  Cooking can be done on the fire pit but pots and food prep area is not provided.

name: Nature Resort Cabanas
description: Some cabanas for rent and grassy area for small campers , right behind the baboon sanctuary.

name: BWEL
description: Propane, refill opportunity next to the HWY

name: Agua Magica
description: Bought a garrafón and 10 gallons of water. They have a drive-through and the place, where the water is filtered and the bottles are filled, looks neat and clean. Paid BZD 20 for plastic bottle and two fillings.

name: Scotia Bank
description: there is a canadian Bank with a ATM on a main road, parking available

name: Thunderbird Marina
description: gasoline, hard to find in this area  was open

name: the ICE Cream Shoppe
description: very good Ice cream, home made. 4Blz$ per scoop but very good Ice

name: River Ferry
description: shortcut from Spanish lookout to San Ignazio. or maybe not if a few cars are ahead of you on the crank driven Ferry.

name: Benny's
description:
Great local food, meat and vegetarian dishes, also offers lots of fresh fruit juices.
Delightful covered outdoor seating with refreshing fans.Great to bring kids as well,playground attached.
Good value.

name: shell gaz station
description: you can refill your water tank for free here

name: Water Taxi to the Cayes
description:
From here the boats take you to Tobacco Caye. You can go with either Captain Munch or Captain Nolan and their boys. Either way it is 80 BZD per person return.
We went with Nolan and it was a fun ride to the island and back. 
He can also take you on a snorkel-trip leaving from Tobacco Caye to snorkel, see birds and manatees for 70 BZD per person.

If you are looking for a spot to park your van while being on the Caye, ask the police to park it in front of their station or Miss Dana to park it in front of D's Backpacker

name: Poderosa Ranch
description:
SEE 01/11/2023 FOR BIG RIG WARNINGS!

Great place. American girl helping her local friend with farming. Access quiet good for being a few minutes out of city. Rv friendly. If you want extremely friendly experience. they cooked for us lunch and dinner. If you want to help with 5-6 hours of labor, you can stay for free. They also took us to 30 mins distance Mennonite town to get product and have a look. Completely recommended if you are looking for this type of experience. Bathroom and cold shower only. No electricity neither WiFi. 20 Belize per niche per vehicle.

name: Gales Point Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Gales Point Wildlife Sanctuary: arrange with Kevin Andrewin for camping (no services), currently free though there may be a small fee in the future. There is level space for several small campers next to Kevin's house. Kevin is a Ranger for the sanctuary and is very involved with manatee and turtle conservation efforts, and will guide small groups by boat to manatee viewing for US$30 per person. Find Kevin at his house, directly next to the "Gales Point Wildlife Sanctuary" sign and just south of Gentles Cool Spot restaurant and guest house. Kevin and his young family were very hospitable when we camped. Kevin may sometimes be reached at +501-662-1440.

name: Scarlet Macaw Bed & Breakfast
description:
Scarlet Macaw Bed and Breakfast engages in eco-tourism. Our signature tour is the seasonal scarlet macaw tours (from November to early March). The scarlet macaw high season is usually in January.  We also offer birding tours (our location is an ideal place for birding) and hiking on well-maintained trails through the lush forest; chocolate processing tours; local food; and comfortable accommodations.  

Rooms consist of either a double-size bed or a bunk bed.  We have on-site parking, spacious yard with trees in the backyard where you can take a peaceful morning or evening stroll.

Scarlet Macaw Bed and Breakfast is a great place to relax, reset your body and mind, and enjoy natural environments. We protect the natural habitats of birds and animals especially the feeding areas of the endangered scarlet macaws. Our location is one of the few places in Belize the scarlet macaws can be seen.

name: Serenity Park
description: RV parking $30 BZE/nightly and one open style cabin with 3 available hammocks only $60 BZE/nightly includes WiFi, Electric, Laundry use for $5 BZE, native oven for baking, 50' boat for fishing and site seeing on the river, 100 meters off the highway close to many villages, all natural experience.

name: UNO Gas Station
description: They let us camp for 1 night for free. Very nice people.

name: scarlet macaws bed and breakfast
description:
we Book a tour to see macaws and other birds here. was 40 bz for us 5 and 10 bz to sleep in our RV (they have rooms too)
the family who runs the place is really nice and helpfull 😊
you can also refill your water tank

name: Argentina’s home made product bakery
description: Local bakery with banana bread, creole bread, ...

name: Treatment Service  (a.k.a. car fumigation)
description:
Entering Belize
First stop: Fumigation
!!!No travel insurance of Belize needed anymore!!!
1. Pull off to the right, go through the car wash looking structure (no one waved us down)
2. Fumigation. Once the van was sufficiently fumigated we were waved through.
3. Drive through and pay ($5 USD) - cash only: BZD, USD and MXN

name: Immigration
description:
1. park & go inside (This is where we met Marvin, the very helpful porter)
2. fill out the tourist card
3. passport stamp
4. we had nothing to declare
5. vehicle permit stamp (needed vehicle registration)
6. left the building & paid border processing fee in the parking lot @ $30BZ ($15BZ for motorbikes)

name: Blue Creek Hillside Motel
description:
Mennonite owned & operated.
8 room hotel at the top of the hill (stop at the house to check in).
$100BZ.
Nice, clean, warm showers, and air conditioning.

There's room for a camper but not sure if there's a public toilet/shower.

name: Deb and Daves Last Resort
description: Quaint little guest house with shared baths and locked secured parking for motorbikes.

name: Tropicool Hotel
description: Simple little place with single beds in private rooms. Shared bath. Good value right on the main walk path downtown. 30 belize dollars. Secure parking for motorbikes.

name: Shipstern Nature Reserve
description:
Has potential, but the point of such a reserve is to see animals and especially birds. Since it opens 2 hours after sunrise, you basically start exploring when all the birds have quieted down and the heat is already out in force. Also, it’s infested with mosquitoes. 

Get up early and take the small road around Sarteneja and you will see much more birds than in the reserve. 

So not recommended, but Sarteneja and around is great.

name: Crooked Tree Wildlife Sanctuary
description:
The Audubon Society now charges an entry fee to the sanctuary. 4 $US per person. They wanted to charge me after I was settled down. They had started charging the very day I arrived. 

Currently the lake water level is abnormally high, thus trails around it are not doable. Also the road that goes to the other side of the village (far west) is also very muddy.  Too hard for motorbike, and I wouldn’t risk it even in a 4x4. So there are boat tours, watching birds around the village and doing nothing.

Still a great place for birds.

name: Hode’s Place
description: Nice acreage in the back to camp with restaurant on the premises. Order the fried chicken, it’s huge. 5$bzd rum punch!

name: Family Shoppin Center
description: We refilled our 5 gal water container for 2.50 Blz. They will fill any type of container.

name: Beef & Poultry
description: Excellent place to buy meat, wide variety of chicken, beef and pork. Sausages, salami, butter, milk, cheese, and other groceries items too. It has a restaurant on site too. All clean and professional. Descent prices.

name: Jungle huts/Phillips fruit tree farm
description: Phillip and his family have a small fruit tree farm and disc golf course. You can stay and play the course for free. And we also bought eggs and fruit. They are a happy family with lots of space to park and camp. Can plug in too.

name: Gravel parking beside the road, near the fence of the church.
description:
Gravel parking beside the road near the fence of the church in front of the bus stop.
Very quiet at night and only a bus in the morning with some few locals.
For free, and you can hear some howler monkeys in the distance.

name: D's Hostel
description:
parking space at the back.
$30 BZD or $15 for a bed with A/C 
No breakfast but kitchen facilities 
Clean and homely run by Rafael and his family

name: Brodies Supermarket
description: Big grocery store who has everything! Also Pharmacy. Not the best for fresh fruits and vegetables but anything else you find here.

name: Tapir Trail Adventure Tours
description:
Tapir trail tours 
Tubing 
Birding 
Chocolate Tour

name: ATM
description:
first ATM we found after crossing to Belize. 
ATM does not work but you can withdraw money from bank. 
schedule monday to friday 8am to 3 pm.

name: Bella's Jungle Camp
description:
ADMIN NOTE: please be aware that this place has been submitted by a stakeholder of the place.

Bella's Jungle Camp is one of a kind. Experience all the jungle has to offer with at our fully equipped, clean and functional hostel in Cristo Rey Village.

Accommodations: 
Campsites, hammocks, dorm beds, double dorm beds, private rooms
laundry service, full kitchen, river access, free kayak rental, free bike rentals, free walking tours 

Price Range: $12.5 USD - $30 USD

name: Pedro’s Hostel & Hotel
description:
Cheapest Accommodation I could find: US$20 for a simple twin room and accepted my dog!
Shared cold showers, nice pool, bar, staff and other backpackers.
15min walk from town and they rent bicycles.

name: Conservation Adventures... Wilderness Kayaking Trips
description: Welcome all overlander adventurers! I have kayaks and an extensive knowledge of places to put in and take out of rivers all over belize... contact me for ideas of what rivers are best to float i can also recommend places to park your vehicle while we go on multi day river camping paddles... I have jungle hammocks and drybags for overnight trips and use your own kayaks or rent one from me, i am licensed tour guide and experienced naturalist living here in Belize for over 20 years...   Come Paddling! www.facebook.com/Belize.Kayaking

name: JDs Auto Services
description:
Stopped due to extremely loud noise in our vehicle we couldn’t pinpoint and wanted to get our vehicle checked out. Mechanic came right out and literally fixed it in 5 minutes. Then we went ahead and got an oil change since we were due. 
Extremely nice guy.

name: Drifted Coconut Hostel
description:
Tame "party hostel" with great vibe and awesome staff. Breakfast included (different prepared meal every day) and free rum punch everyday during happy hour. Great place to meet other young travelers. 

$25US for 2 people in a dorm. Prices were higher due to semana santa). Facilities were sub par. No windows so dark in dorms and dingy bathrooms. Nevertheless, if you are on Caye Caulker and want to do it cheap, this is a really fun place to stay.

name: Insurance Corp. of Belize
description:
Extended our policy here in a matter of 10 minutes. Nice and easy.

http://www.icbinsurance.com/

name: Belize Diesel Equipment co. Ltd
description: We had a problem with our spring Leafs . This Shop help us and do a good cheap work. Its possible to Camp at the workshoparea. We stay here 2 Weeks . Very friendly People!

name: Builders Hardware
description: Big Hardware store, kinda like Home Depot. Has propane canisters for Coleman stoves!

name: Shell Gas station with non-potable water
description: There is a tap that you can screw in your hose on to fill up you water. This is non-potable water but perfect for dishes & shower. Free !!

name: Quality Poultry Products
description: Best place to buy meat like chicken & beef. Also a little grocery store and a restaurant on site.

name: Amigo Welding
description:
Got this place recommended by Graham from the Land Rover Shop. We had our door and the rear step welded. 
Phone: 605-1639

name: Water water
description: 5 gallons for $3. They have automatic machines and can run a hose to your van

name: G.L.B poolside Restaurant and Cabins
description: 2 cabins, pool under construction, restaurante working well, Mark and his Wife make great food and are very good people!

name: Chateau De Pradines
description:
Eco Camping Grounds with community Bathroom,a little Kitchen and a Botanical Garden (cabins & a restaurant are in our development plans).

Free Wi-Fi available.

name: Immigration office
description: Immigration. You can extend visa here but NOT a vehicle permit. If you must go here make an appointment; as a walk in you have to line up at 6am to put your name on a list at 7am. We were #20 and it took 8 hours of waiting in the parking lot. Vehicle permits can only be done at a border and is quick and easy. My advice is just drive to the Guatamalan border, do your paperwork and drive back to Belmopan, it will be quicker and easier on your blood pressure.

name: Supermarket
description:
Supermarket in Belize with a good variety of groceries. 
Decent prices for Belizean standards I guess?

name: Ignacio&Senovia
description:
We spent an amazing few days with a local Mayan couple literally in the middle of the rainforest!
