You need equipment like tent but you can ask them to sell you meals - which is anyways the only option there. Ignacio is just collecting food right from his field or directly from the forest. They have homely grown coffee and cacao what we roasted and grinded together with them. They have a spring on their land and you can drink water from there. They live right on the river bank, so you can get here actually on foot or by boat. Ignacio can also show you around. Downsides: lots of insects, no proper toilet or shower. They speak good English, and the place is beautiful, you can birdwatch or swim in the river. We lost our phone with the exact coordinates so just ask the guy called Eladio chocolattte (around where we dropped the location) where Ignacio lives, it is a 40 mins walk.

Filip&Eszter

name: Patrick’s tour
description:
Excellent snorkel tour with Patrick, a local guy. 
65$US/adult, half-price for children, for a day trip with lunch, snacks and water. 
We saw beautiful coral Reef, turtles, rays and dolphins !
You can book by what’sapp +5016355843 and leave from this point or another place in Hopkins, as you want !

name: Bélize parking
description: Parking near the small airport of Bélize. We stay on the parking near Tropical Air where we bought tickets to see the Blue Hole by plane. 500 $BL P/p. Expansive but very nice to see. Parking free. Wifi without password. Quiet at 6pm until 7am

name: Sandfly's Ranch
description: This is the lakeside property of Sandfly a generous old local man. There are two palapas to park next to, benches, tables, sink with running water. Outdoor bathrooms and a shower. And a paddleboat. no electricity. No sandflies, cooler temperature than the coast, no blazing hot 6am wake up. Sandfly was super sweet and cooked fry jacks and rice and beans while telling us crazy stories. Quite the character he also has 5 dogs and Canela is currently a bit aggressive as she has a litter of puppies right now. Although there is no specific cost per night a tip is expected and he is incredibly generous with what he has to offer.

name: Mountain Pine Ridge Camping Permit Office
description:
This is where you go to get a camping permit for the Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve. It costs 5 BZ per person per night. Can’t camp at Pine Ridge anymore without this permit. 

The permit process is complicated, takes multiple stops, takes about an hour, and only allows you to camp at the military campground. Ended up going to Old Mei Git campground instead and paying only 5 BZ per car, no permit needed.

name: Old Mei Git Campground
description: Nice campground in the park with lots of grassy area. Costs only 10 BZ per car, cheapest option at Mountain Pine Ridge Park. Bathrooms and showers available. No permit needed to camp here.

name: Next to the river!
description: Super nice free wild camping next to the river. No facilities. Free. Locals said it’s safe. Amazing first stop after crossing from Guatemala.

name: Checo Hill Farm
description: You can park on a grass field beneath the guest house. Electricity is possible with a long cordel. If one apartment is free you can use the shower there. Kate and Adam are very welcoming. Good if you want to explore Mennonite villages nearby or walk/cycle to the Mountain Ridge Park and the waterfalls (To Big Rock Falls 2h by bike).

name: Taller Jimenez
description:
Taller Jimenez
Welding and body work, this family did great, fair price. They may change pesos for Belize if you need it.

name: San Pedro Beliz Express Ferry
description: Ferry to the cayes. $28 us dollars return ticket pp to Caye Caulker. We got 50% off discount coupons at the border with Guatemala (not sure if it happened because it was low season)

name: Corozal Blues
description: Great restaurant next to the water. big rig have to park outside the gate, but in sight. very nice setting, try beans and rice - traditional belizean dish- or one of the pizzas. They have a traditional wood oven. recommend

name: Windschief beachbar and cabanas
description: Nice little beach bar with two cabanas and a mini golf course. Direct on the beach with a fantastic view on the sea. Very clean rooms and everything up to date. From the cabana balconies you can watch the dolphins and manatees crossing. Pamela and Oliver run the business very well! http://www.windschief.com/

name: Casa Rickys
description:
Ricky is extremly helpful and friendly. He has an appartment with a kitchen incl. cooking stuff, a huge tv, a couch and upstairs a king size bed  with a mosquito net. 2 fans and towels are also provided. Cost is 60 Belize $. He also offers 3 rooms with a shared bathroom and a cabaña for 40 Belize $. Absolutely recommended 

You can book, www.casarickys.com
WhatsApp: +5016343759

name: Wish Willy River Cabanas
description: The owners have three short term cabanas and one long term apartment.  They overlook the McCal river with Santa Elena and San Ignacio in the background.  Absolutely stunning views with gorgeous birds, including Toucans in the morning and a variety of hummingbirds throughout the day.  The owners are wonderful human beings and very knowledgeable about Belize.  Spend your evening sitting on the porch watching big Iguanas crawling through the bamboo and sunning beside you.  Enjoyed several Belkins (official Belizian beer) and even dined with the owners.  Great experience...

name: Sarfield whole wheat bakery
description: Bakery with fresh different whole wheat products and pastry.

name: Everest Restaurant
description: Nepalese/Indian Restaurant with all kind of traditional food - lots of vegetarian and also vegan options. small booth. everything freshly prepared by the owner himself. Excellent chutney and lassi.

name: Mopan Gas Station
description: safe place to park a motorhome and spend the night. Very close to Guatemala's border. We only ask the manager and he allowed us to park. Free. Bathroom clean.

name: Chuc's Service Station
description: Decent looking mechanic shop that repaired our tire for 25BZ. Recommended by multiple locals we spoke to.

name: Glover Atoll Resort
description:
Private Island in the caribean ocean of Belize, at the Glover Atoll Marina Reserve.
 Basic accomodation with kitchen, toilette and rain water shower. Diver/snorkerling opptions of accomodation, as tent camping, beach hut, ocean hut and dorm rooms, self catering or with meals. A week starts at+/- 150$US. A perfect place to snorkel, dive and relax.

name: Bay Breeze
description:
Good wifi and the tradition dish of chicken, rice & beans was great! We were able to also have glasses of water. The service was good and you can have views of the ocean across the street.

We also asked if we could park outside - no problem and the wifi reached us in the van.

name: Northern Vetenary Clinic
description: Vet close to the highway if you need to get health certificate for México! It’s 50 BZ and we had to wait for three hours.

name: Blue/green  restaurant
description:
Super nice, cheap and good place for lunch ! 
Super smiling workers !
all prices on photos, on September 2018.
7$ for a whole (big) plate of fried chicken with vegetables, rice&beans cooked with coco !

name: Hibiscus
description: Delicious and cheap local dishes for under 2$BZ. Must try the burrito. Hey

name: Mauricio's Camp
description:
Mauricio is in the process of building cabañas and bathrooms for travelers and researchers; he welcomes Overlanders to his property.  He is a local guide at the Lamanai Ruins and is extremely knowledgeable and interested local flora and fauna, especially birds.    Mauricio speaks fluent English and is a wonderful resource for Belizean information.

Mauricio Alberto Aguilar - Indian Church Village
aguilarmauricio606@gmail.com

name: River ferry
description: Hand crank ferry, fits 4 cars. We saw a small croc in the river.

name: Outside Dangriga
description: Continue along a old asphalt road south of Dangriga. This was the second beach access we tried and liked it more than the first one which was too narrow. There is some garbage here and place seems used by locals, but nobody showed up on friday night during our visit.

name: Surf & Turf Restaurant
description: Nice little bar restaurant that accepts visa payment (one of the only ones we could find). Ceviche, salpicon, burgers. Has wifi as well.

name: Aguacate Lagoon
description:
Great place to spend the night, cool, nice breeze and absurdly quiet. 
A local told me about this place, so I drove to it. It has some leveled spots, next to a lagoon. When I came it was raining a lot, so the water was not clear. Also told me that there are some medium size crocodiles around, so its good to be aware.

The road is good, I had to cross a small water stream on solid cement, water rose up to half the height of my wheels (medium size SUV), and it was raining a lot the day before.

There are some picnic tables under a roof, really nice!

name: Best Spot on the Beach!
description:
Camped here for a night after a local told us it's crown land and we could camp there for free.

Felt so safe (which hasn't happened in a while for us). 

A nice public jetty a couple minutes further down the road. 

Absolutely GORGEOUS clear, blue water. Amazing sunset...Only woken by the early sunrise!

Mosquitos were irksome but to be expected.

name: Green Coleman propane tanks- Augusto Quan
description:
A place in Central American to find the “hard-to-find” Coleman Camping propane tanks.  $14.48BSD $7.24USD. 

Nice to find!

name: Insurence corporation of Belize
description: U can extend your car insurance here it cost me 30 blz for a week

name: Reef Friendly Tours
description:
We had an amazing snorkeling experience with Captain Amado and his team. This eco-friendly company is the only one taking care of the reef and marine life conservation, avoiding to harass animals...and not giving plastic water bags to their clients. Our guides were really nice and knowledgeable, we got to see everything, swim with Manatees, sharks and sting ray! As you go two hours earlier and in smaller groups, you are alone with them. For the same price as the others (65 usd full day; 35usd half day), do not hesitate, well worth the detour. 

Snorkeling was good, just as described before. But when you intend to rent a Gopro-Camera, make sure that there is a second camera on baord in the case that your camera doesn't work or the battery is empty as it happened to me

name: Hattieville jail craftshop
description: interesting place where the inmates serve you in their prison overalls and sell their crafts. Not super-helpful bargains, but normal Belize prices. Worth a quick stop-by if you are passing.

name: Overnight stay, free
description: 2 spaces: one smaller and one bigger good for overnight stay. We had a peaceful and undisturbed night. We felt safe. No facilities. There is enough space for big rigs but the entrence is pretty narrow.

name: River front
description: Great little fishing community welcomes travellers to park on the waters edge at the shaded spots all along here no traffic /music or noise other than falling coconuts. Great LTE reception

name: coastal breeze
description: A residential road on a well needed sea breeze road. No passing traffic. Well guarded houses. Quieter than Radisson, free and a good aeroplane spotting spot.

name: Casa Placencia
description: Very friendly place. We paid 70USD per night, garden room with AC,TV, fan, fridge, coffee machine, internet and private toilet of course. One can use small swimming pool and bikes for free. Everything very clean and well organised. Parking outside, along the fance but the owner assures that is safe. Jackie is a super nice person, very knowlegable about Placencia and Belize in general. And her bakes - more than delicious!!! She is famous for it! Really recommend the place. We used bikes and visited all Placencia.Nice short break.

name: ATM scotiabank - no fee
description: I withdraw 600 bzd no fee. The amount could be higher.

name: Shady garden next to ruta
description: We asked the owners if we could chill here for the hottest hours of the day and they were more than welcoming, telling us to stay for a few nights. There is a guard and a toilet, the place is nice for one night.

name: Red snapper fish market
description: Local fishermen sell thier reds here.... you will need a large fridge! Enjoy

name: ATM Caves turnoff
description: Rough road to ATM cave rough road from here on in The best cave to explore with a guide Must be prebooked as they are trying to restrict the numbers  but well worth the hassle

name: San estevan
description:
in the way to San Esteban, spot next to the ferry to cross the river (free, small tip appreciated), ok for all vehicles.  Location away from the road, very quiet, flat and with grass.
 The other side 4x4 mandatory for the ground clearance.

name: ATM Belize Bank - no fee
description: ATM with no fees, we got 600 BZ$, next door is a good stocked supermarket

name: Belize Zoo
description:
Stopped and spent a couple hours here on our way to Hopkins. Small zoo but nicely done with a very natural flair. Most animals were rescued so your entrance fee is for a great cause.. Entrance Fee is 15 US$ or 30 BZ$, you can pay with card. Children under 5yrs are free.
We saw most of the animals.

name: Happy Go Luckie Tours
description:
We made the Bioluminescence Boattour with Luckie. We started at 6 pm and first he showed us crocodiles, different birds, opossums and a group of coatimundis. After that we drove in the Andersons Lagoon. It was sooo amazing. White glowing algae if they are moved. Beautiful. The Tour took 2 hours.
35 US$/person
You can make a reservation: info@hgltours.com or www.hgltours.com

name: Chaa Creek Lodge and nature reserve
description: A very attractive looking lodge with a small museum and interesting butterfly breeding centre, blue morpho and owl butterflies. Informative tour. In the reserve they have marked several trails through the forest. I was too late for birds but they have recorded308 different birds in the reserve. Map available. Butterflies tour + hiking about 10US.

name: Jeremiah’s Inn
description:
Not the nicest room, but one of the few options that allows dogs (at least right now, Island is pretty close to capacity). Has aircon and fan, but no towels. Our booking.com booking didn’t reach the hotel, best to book directly.

MODERATOR COMMENT: Google provided contact info +501 630-3854

name: Medical centre
description:
A very nice Guatemalan trained doctor. Speaks Spanish and English. Reasonably priced private doctor (40 BZ for consultation). Good diagnostician. Can refer out for blood tests, etc.
See photo for business card

name: Crash Pad / Alternate Adventures Rentals
description:
Very stylish and cute accommodation. At the moment only 4 private rooms, but the dorm and communal area will be finished later as well.
Emma, your host, is super helpful and running a motorcycle rental company as well. There is a garage to lock a few motorcycles and we were able to work on the bikes too. Borrowing tools and stuff. 
At the time we had a few bikers down here, great fun.

name: Floresita's Fast Food
description: Delicious cheap traditional Belizean food served by the very friendly Floresita - very understand of vegetarian needs too!

name: Mrs Cheb
description: Laundry/dry-cleaning service; pricey (though probably not by Belizean standards - they charge by the pound; we paid $23 BZD for 8 pounds or so) but fast and friendly.

name: Richard for secure vehicle storage
description:
If you're going out of Dangriga to Tobacco Caye or other island, Richard can store your vehicle in secured, gated yard in front of his house (pit bull chained in the yard for added deterrent).  Paid 50bzd for three nights.  +501 627 9029.

Came recommended by consierge at Windward lodge on Tobacco Caye so felt comfortable.  Richard will arrange to meet you at Riverside cafe and guide you to his house.

name: Gormiers vegan / vegetarian restaurant
description:
On the way into punta gorda.   Cool
Vibe.  Ocean front.    Home made tofu!!!!!!     Small and friendly owner.

name: Tates’ Guesthouse
description:
Clean place with shared kitchen. Hot showers and slow WiFi.
We could park our bikes behind the locked gate.
75B$ for a one double bed room with AC.
90B$ for a two double bed room with AC.
Friendly owners.

name: Western regional hospital
description: Small Regional hospital in Belmopan.    Free

name: Hokey Pokey Ferry Terminal
description: Ferry terminal car park. Asked permission at the terminal to stay the night in my van; they said no problem. Sandy parking lot, space for big rigs. Didn't explore but no obvious facilities. Quiet all night and felt safe.

name: Punta Gorda Immigrations
description: From here you can take a water taxi to Guatemala. Departure tax etc. payable with card at the immigration desk.

name: San Ignacio Public Library Parking Lot
description:
Decent spot. Fairly quiet for being in the city. We felt safe here as it is so close to the main square in town and the police station. If you park in the right stall you are visible from the main roundabout/street of San Ignacio.

No amenities but there is a view of the river that you can also walk down to in case of emergency bathroom situation or whatnot.

name: free wifi in the park
description:
Free wifi in the little city park
Nothing more to say.

name: In front of police station
description: We wanted to spend one night before crossing to Guatemala. The river wild camping spot didn’t feel very safe, so we drove to the police station and they told us to park in a public parking lot right in front of their station.  A little bit noisy during the day, but very safe at night. Good spot for one night.

name: Atlantic Bank CASH BACK
description: Withdraw money with you card from bank. Most atm didn’t work and the bank offered this service. 10 bzd service fee. Make sure you take your passport. ATLANTIC BANK

name: Purified water. didnt stop
description: They sell purified water. I didnt stop there.

name: Body 2000 gym
description: Not really a camp spot but a place to get a shower. The manager let me use the showers for free.

name: Football field parking lot
description:
Parking lot is a dead end leading to a park. A soccer field on the left and a private property on the right.
We spent a Sunday night there and it was very peaceful.

name: Scarlet Macaw Paradise
description:
This place is owned by Celso Sho. He has a sign on the main road through the village that says “Macaws” and another outside his house that says “Macaw tickets sold here”. He said there’s a community cooperative that sells tickets to visit the Macaws. In return they work to preserve their habitat and maintain the trails.
If you wish to contact him ahead of time his details are: scarletmacaw246@gmail.com or tel: +501 638 2727. Their FB page is https://www.facebook.com/redbankscarletmacaw. 
He offered to guide us or to draw us a map to go on our own. We opted for the self-adventure. He charged us $30BZ for two. He also allowed us to camp on his land for the night. There was a water tap where potentially you could fill your tank but I didn’t ask.
The town is a lovely Mayan town and a very nice to spend a night. Best time to see the Macaws is early morning or late afternoon.

name: SLIM's bar and grill
description:
Very good food. For 2 meals + 2 sodas we paid 15 USD.
Just next to the road, friendly service

name: Coningsby Inn
description: A nice little hotel. Cut us a deal one the number of people staying. A/C and hot shower. Clean and in a quiet neighborhood near the Cathedral. We felt safe here, away from what seemed like slums.

name: Propane Refill Station.  No sign.
description: This propane refuel station is just North of the village of Silk Grass on the highway ("Southern Hwy") that connects Dangriga and Hopkins.  It is on the East side of the road. It was open on a holiday sunday.  We filled our standard BBQ sized propane tank for $27BZD ($5.40/Gallon). Look for the large white and red propane tanks and small white building on stilts.

name: Sunshine View Hotel
description: A GREAT FIND! Only open since January 2019. A bright, colorful, secure, modern, hotel directly on the Caribbean Sea. The view from our balcony was the sea. Boardwalk and cabanas. All the amenities of a modern hotel in America. A great place to stay if you’re in Corozal Belize. HIGHLY recommended.

name: M&N Guesthouse
description: Rooms with balcony in small houses for 90 B$ p/N in the main season. It has good showers, a fridge and two double beds. Also chairs and hammocks. Without AC but two fans. Also a community kitchen.

name: Harbour to the Cayes
description: Different fisherman take you to the Caye Tobacco and others. 20 US $ p./P. with a minimum group size of four. (When you insist to go with 2P. it's 80 US$)

name: Scotia Bank with ATM
description: Scotia bank with no fees. Right in the mainstreet close to the Caye Harbour. Also 2 supermarkets next door.

name: Chaleanor Hotel
description: Safe storage for 7,50 US $ per night. Camping in front costs the same and the people are very nice. Could use all facilities.

name: University Blvd
description:
3 Bzd for 20 liters now
Open:
MO-FR: 07:30 - 5:30
SA: 08:00 - 03:00

name: Home Protector Insurance Co.
description:
Right after the border. 50B$ for à month (29B$ for à week) third part only. Very friendly and helpful. In case of accident, the two drivers need to go to the police station together to make a report  and then you call your insurance. 

À droite tout de suite après la border.

name: Blue Wave Guesthouse
description: Really nice and clean hotel. We stayed in a private room with shared bathroom for 32usd per night. They also have rooms with private bathroom. The kitchen and community area are clean and comfortable. They also have a private dock on the beach.

name: Aegea Blues Restaurant and Banquitas House of Culture Parking
description:
This is a shaded, concrete parking lot off Main St, below the elevated House of Culture and behind Aegea Blues Restaurant.  It is surrounded by nice green lawn directly on the river.  
We went to the restaurant for a few Belikin ($4BZD) and were talking with the owner about our travels.  She told us we were welcome to park over night in the lot, so log as we were out at a reasonable hour in the morning.  It's customer parking only.  This was a far better place to camp than where we originally planned to park, on the side of the road at the library.  It was quiet and shady, and there is security at night.  The restaurant has slow wifi.  The staff were really friendly and came by to say hello in the morning. There are bathrooms, which were opened for us early in the morning, around d 7:30-8.  
Alternatively, the librarians said that sometimes overlanders ask if they can park at the library and they always let them stay there.  The police station is directly across the road from the library.  In either case, be courteous and ask first.

name: Check point
description:
Easy check point. They check if the tacky car insurance is in plain sight in the windshield.

Check point tranquille. Ils vérifient si le collant des assurances auto sont bien à la vue dans le pare-brise.

name: boondocking dans la rue
description: We wanted to spend the night in the Radisson car park (where we left the van for 3 nights) but the caretaker suggested parking on the street (and avoid paying $ 20 more). Right in front of the Taiwan Consulate, safe, well-lit street and we can trust the consulate watchdogs!

name: BELIZE TO MEXICO
description:
1. Exit Belize = 40B/person (can pay by cards) 
2. Cancel car permit
3. Mexico immigration: took all our food. Everyting. Fruits, veggies, meet, eggs. Asked for rice beans and cereal. We said we didnt have any. They havent check.
4. They didnt charge for the tourists cards (?)
5. Second check. They open the truck only. Very friendly, english speaking.
6. Fulmigation. 95pesos

name: Western Diaries Water
description: The other places in Spanish Lookout don't have water anymore. 1 Garafon is 4.50 BZD

name: Belmopan Tiny Houses
description:
Very cute little houses, fully furnished in a quiet area. 
There are several seats in the garden and there is a possibility to camp.
Motorcycles park inside the fence.
Very good value for money.

name: Captain Hooks Shrimp Restaurant
description: A fabulous restaurant situated among the shrimp ponds just outside Belize City.  We had a fantastic meal, curried shrimp for one of us and coconut shrimp with mango chutney which was to die for. Lovely view of the area, a great breeze to cool you down and outstanding staff.  They also have a swimming pool, which is open on weekends.

name: Lamanai Tour
description:
Fantastic tour and guide to visit Lamanai. One-hour boat ride to reach these amazing ruins. 

Overall very interesting, guides are passionate and will explain to you, history, animals, mangrove... we saw crocodiles, thousand of birds, monkeys and were almost alone on Lamanai ruins. What an experience ! 

The tour starts only morning, food is provided for lunchtime (excellent !) and you will be back early afternoon. Our guide Colin was very interesting and explained many things about Maya and Belize. 

You can also camp on their parking by the river (free - cf iOverlander camping spot).

name: bad road
description: if driving from belize to Mexico, don't follow Google maps directions along this part of the northern highway. go through corozal instead. the road conditions on this part of the highway is littered with enormous potholes and will add significant time to your journey

name: Camping at Family's House.
description:
We arrived at the touristic information hunting a camping. We where told there is no camping near the beach. After a little talk we went to Grace's house, just beside the tourist information.
Grace a very nice woman in her 80's allowed us to park and camp our SUV rooftented and use her bathroom and shower. 
Also has potable water outside the house.
Stayed just at 5 m from the ocean.
Quiet and safe.
Just no waves at the morning. Perfect do bath in the Caribbean.
Be gentle with Grace and she will let you stay. We payed her the next day. $B20,00 for 2 pearsons.

name: Hidden Haven
description: 3 x self catering cabanas with A/C, plus 18 bed mixed dormitory.  40ft.x 20ft salt water swimming pool, with restaurant

name: Camping Near the Beach
description:
Nice place right after the Sun Shine View Hotel. It is a very collored hotel at a little road right handed before you reach the beach comming from Orange Walk.
Good shadow, 5 meters from the Caribbean Ocean.
The beach was a little dirty because the people during the day leave garbage. Stupids that make a nice place look a little bad.
Very quiet. 
In the middle of the night came the police and asked if everything was OK. Very educated and professional. Good breeze from ocean. Grassy area.
No facilities because it is a wild camp area. Free.

name: Scotibank
description: At this ATM it is possible to get money without paying a fee.

name: AJAW Chocolate & Crafts
description:
Hands-on tour of the process of harvesting and preparing cacao as well as the significance for the Mayan culture. We enjoyed it and recommend it.

12USD pp for the hour long tour, includes lots of tasting. :)

name: Calla Creek
description: A free spot to spend the day in the creek and enjoy the scenery. This is where the locals hang out! Had a lovely time here, felt very welcome by the locals there with their families, and actually liked it more than Clarissa Falls.

name: Kilies tire and welding services
description: Tire repair and much needed welding services.  All the tall speed bumps have knocked the battery tray loose on the rv.  He reinforced the tray and added a bracket.  $25 Belize Dollars.  Drop in service.  Nice large parking area for vehicles.   I drive a 25' Class C.

name: Naturalist Guided Kayaking Trips
description: This is one of the places to meet to go kayaking with Conservation Adventures... we can explore the nearby lagoon systems in the night and experience the Biolumanescent Plankton that light up the water as we paddle through the mangrove channels and around the lagoon.   Conservation Adventures is a great way to get out paddling if you ha e your own kayak or want to rent one, we offer guided birdwatching paddles in the early morning and also many amazing multi day camping excursions with Jungle Hammocks and Dry Bags...  there is a lot to explore in belize by kayak...  contact us or check out our facebook page... www.facebook.com/Belize.Kayaking

name: Spot next to river
description:
Street parking at the end of the road close to bridge.
We parked here for one night.
Nobody bothered us.
Quiet place

name: Uno gas station
description:
little gas station off of main road. decent prices and nice staff. There are not a lot of gas stations on this stretch of highway going south.
update: 3 more stations south!

name: HOBBS Craft Brewery
description: nice little brewery. I marked it hear becasue we drove past it on our way up the peninsula. but its down the peninsula on the way to Placencia. after the mango resturaunt. really good beer. but it was expensive. we chalked it up as a treat since we hadn't had really good beer since the Brewery in Colima MX. we paid 39$Belize for a 6pack. we got free stickers and beer cozies with our purchase as well as testers. it might be cheaper if you have your own growler to fill. Its owned by an American an Canadian duo. Worth the little stop if your in this area.

name: Road Closed for Rio Bravo Conservation Area
description:
You need to spend a night at the lodge in order to drive through, contact details in attached picture. 

We asked around and got a number to call (PFBelize Hill Bank Field Station: +501 615 3900, contact details attached in photos). They told us the only way to be allowed to drive through is when you spend a night at the lodge (we guess they mean La Milpa lodge). Camping is not permitted and driving through not either when you don't spend the night.

name: T.R.E.E.S Fondation Volunteering
description:
We were working 15 days in Exchange of 3 daily meals, parking, toilet and shower. You can also ask for a bed (we slept in the van). Good farming work in an organic farm. Nice people. 
info@treesociety.org

name: Vans Natural Wine
description:
A local family that makes their own wine.  Really great wine! Evan experiments with all the yummy fruits of Belize. This place was shown to us by locals. Great guy let us try the wines he has available. Worth the stop. 15blz /bottle. He sells to resorts that upsale his wine. So if you can, come support him locally. His facebook is Vans Natural Wine and his email is jasoncastillo534@yahoo.com 
Phone #: 6532199
Amazing wine we bought 3 bottles and tried fruit we have never even heard of. Amazing expierence.

name: Tanias Guest House
description:
This is an amazing little spot. The host Marie is such a lovely lady who runs this guesthouse. The rooms are affordable starting at 30blz/night. You can contact the family through any travel fare search website or you can call or email at 
501-523-7058
501-652-2101
501-615-8821
taniarodge@gmail.com
Such an inviting family. Very much worth the stay. She also said she doesnt mind people staying on her property in their vehicles, no payment necessary but if you want to donate its much appreciated. Pets are not allowed in the rooms but are welcome outside.

name: Bahay Fiesta Restaurant and Bar
description: Nice restaurant offering campgrounds for all sizes. Grassy ground. Very clean. You can use toilets and shower. Very safe. The owner Josh lives here as well and can take care of your rig while you are exploring the beach. Beach just a 2 minutes walk away. 20 Belize Dollars per person.

name: Bellas Backpak
description:
Hostel where you can camp for 15 vz, there are toilets, electricity, internet. They lend you snorkel, canoe and bicycles. There is carafe water. Friendly. Say hello to the west side of the island.
---
Hostal donde se puede acampar por 15 vz, hay baños, luz, internet. Te prestan snorkel, canoa y bicicletas. Hay agua de garrafón. Amigables.saluda al lado oeste de la isla.

name: Fi We Mart
description:
Probably the best supermarket in Hopkins. Opened recently and has a huge range. They have almost everything you need: fresh and frozen food/beverages/huge range of abroad items/sun lotion/motor oil/light bulbs/tools/ kids toys/paper/laundry detergent... 
and they are cheap.

name: M & A Laundromat
description:
Super Nice People working there. 

Wash: 5$
Dry:    3 $
Soap: 2 $

Open from 7am - 9pm. 

They doing the laundry for you!

name: Border crossing: Guatemala -> Belize
description:
From Guatemala to Belize:

1. Cross bridge and park at white building to your right.
2. Migracion and Aduana of Guatemala is inside white building
3. MIGRACION: get passport stamped
4. ADUANA: hand over TIP and sticker. 
5. Drive to Fumigation and pay accordingly and get receipt (see pricelist in photos)
6. Park in front of green building
7. Migration and Aduana for Belize is inside green building
8. 1st window: show passport + let person know where you're staying. Get stamp in passport
9. Aduana desk ahead of you. Show license, passport and registration. TIP is stamped into your passport
10. Go through door to your right and pay outside at little window for import of vehicle (Moto 15 BZD)
11. Drive through last check and leave border (nobody checked my fumigation receipt)
12. After 100m on the right: stop at little house with orange roof to buy 

All in all very easy and straightforward.

name: Next to a sportfield
description:
nice and shady place (public parc) next to a little basketballfield, friendly locals, some musik around and barking dogs.
* police showed up right as I was leaving, claimed the land was a federal preservation and I had 2 choices,
1. Go to PD station & pay $500BZ fine
2. Pay them $250BZ
Park clearly has a sign stating it is a public park, confirmed with local. 
Police plate # B-3163  Don’t feed corruption!

name: police checkpoint
description: Small police check. Wanted to see the driver's licence (including international), took a photo of the car and the DL. Asked about destination. 2 minutes in total. Friendly and sweaty.

name: Darci's Laundry
description: Cheap, quick, closer to the retreat place than the other one.

name: Joanne Tallman
description: Canadian couple has purchased 2 lots on the hill overlooking all of Santa Elena, Santa Familia, San Ignacio and Spanish look out. Min. from town we have started to develop a camping  resort. At this point it's pretty basic but we can offer R.V. camping. We have a sani dump as well as water can be purchased for refilling holding tanks. Generators and solar will be required at this time for electrical power.

name: Carribean Sprinter
description:
ferry company for Caye Calker and San Pedro. 

seems to be the cheapest company and the only one owned by Belizean
36 bzd return to caye caulker

name: The Palate Place
description:
New hostel, opened a few days before we arrived. The owners are really nice, and have built a beautiful place if you want to stay few nights in San Pedro. They provide private rooms and a 7 beds dorm, price is about 20BD$ for the dorm. 
If you stay in the dorm, they even provide you a towel and a beach towel, eventually some snorkeling equipment, soap in the shower (warm, if needed), and a locker with a key for you. You can borrow bikes as well. Coffee and tea in the morning. hammocks and couches.
One socket per bed, one fan and one light per bed. Everything is really clean and new.  High standard in this hostel, and for reasonable price!! Definitely recommend it.

name: Belize Sea Reef Inn
description: I am not sure if this is the same place as Jerimiahs Inn under a new name, but the only sign outside is Belize Sea Reef Inn. I negotiated a deal with these people; the room consisted of a private toilet and shower and air conditioning. I also confirmed with them what was included. After wandering around the village, I came back to my room to find the aircon remote had been removed. When I queried this, I was shouted at saying the deal was without aircon. If I wanted aircon, I would have to pay 70% extra! Avoid this place, they are a bunch of crooks!

name: Police checkpoint
description: Police check point. They stopped 2 local vehicles. For us, they just checked our insurance and asked where we were heading to.

name: Médical center parking
description: we stopped on a Sunday afternoon in the parking lot of this medical center.  very calm and safe night.  On Monday morning the center staff just asked us to move a bit if we wanted to stay there.

name: Laundry service at Backpackers Paradise
description: Laundry service at Backpackers Paradise for 5 US per person, sun dry !

name: Vehicle storage at Backpackers Paradise
description: Vehicle storage at Backpackers Paradise for 5 US per day. Leave safely your van here and visit the islands with the boat, one departure everyday at 7.30 am. Taxi service available to the pier for 5 US. Garage for motorbikes available 5 US a day.

name: Hostel at Backpackers Paradise
description: Backpackers Paradise is a camping, cabana, hostel, very quiet, surrounded by nature. Its a true chilling experience to see the horses roaming free around the cabines in a beautiful well maintained tropical garden. You will enjoy a big communal area with a 360 degrees garden view, communal full equipped kitchen, hot showers, comfy dorm beds for 17 US, private cabines start at 44 US, wifi everywhere. Camping for 10 US per person.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Police checkpoints. ........................

name: Latitude 17
description: This is a great hotel with a variety of affordable rooms. They also will rent a spot for tents and provide showers/bathrooms. The owner Wade is very knowledgeable for the area and helpful.

name: Marylins creoles kitchen
description: Great small place with home cookin! Nice people, good prices, delicious food! 8 belize dollars for a large plate, 5 belize dollars for a small one. they have home made pies and cinnamon rolls as well :)

name: Insurance Corporation of Belize Ltd.
description:
We came late in at the border and the Insurance Comoany Shop was closed. So in town you can make your insurunce from 8 a.m. on a week day.

We paid for 14 days: 46 Belize-$. Eletronic cash is possible.

name: the Little Kitchen
description: really good food served in a local place.  ignore all the rubbish and stuff dumped outside on your way to the entrance, inside is spotless.  great choice of seafood at very reasonable prices and great choice of fresh juices too.  lobster dinner plus juice was bz$33.

name: Uno Gas Station
description: We ask for water and we could fill it up. It's not drinking water but for shower and cooking it's ok. It was for free.

name: Sandy Lane Guest House
description: basic but clean and comfortable. Great location in the town and near the ferry. some rooms have kitchenette, some have private bathroom (bz$40 + tax) and some are shared bathroom (bz$30 + tax). Quiet at night not during the day because of the location. Great value for this island.

name: Econodiesel
description:
Very qualified Mennonite mechanical workshop. Huge warehouses for parts in Spanish Lookout. Labour pretty reasonably prized.
Checked whole car, especiall repaired injectors, test of engine.

name: Southwest Energy
description:
The last gas station we saw in South Belize. It is at the turnoff for the road to Punta Gorda. No more shops or gas stations further south.
50 meters up the road is also a more modern Uno Gas Station.

name: La Cubana - very bad
description:
Terrible place to sleep.
Looks good during day. Small rooms for two, not expensive.
But sportsbar next door has a party bar till midnight. Windows don't close so street noise all night. Ac so old that when one room uses it the whole building shakes and its like trying to sleep on an airplane. And worst the owner doesn't care because she is one of the noisy people...
We would highly recommend to sleep far away from here.

name: Luba Laruga
description:
One of our most favorite spots in Belize! it's a very pretty little restaurant right on the beach with hammocks picnic tables and some palm trees for shade. Shanon is a cool and relaxed Garifuna dude, who cooks delicious food (different to the meals you usually get in Belize - try the filet fish with coconut rice, fried plantanes or steamed vegetables it's amazing!!!). He let us park right at the beach front for 5 BZ per person (more parks in the yard - see photo). He also accepts working for staying / food. Basic toilet and shower, good WiFi, no plug ins for power, no shade for the car. 
Overall it's a lovely place to spend a few days and relax by the beautiful ocean front! Shops are in walking distance, which is handy too. Also we were driving around the ocean side for quiet some time - this is by far the best we could find!

name: Dario’s Meatpies
description:
Small hole in the wall that makes and sell amazing meat pies (chicken or beef). 
Supposed to be the best meatpies, they are really delicious! 
$1.25BZD per pie

name: windy point
description: We went to 2 other places near by and neither one would let us stay. However they both told us of these beach front cleared lots. They said no one would bother us there. It is a beautiful windy ocean site. We had a quiet restful night there.

name: Crabby's
description: This restaurant has really nice people and good food. We asked if we could stay on the beach across the street and use their bathrooms and they said yes. Beach is muddy here but just down the road abit is a better beach. It was abit noisy in early evening but you are down town.

name: Caribbean motors
description:
We needed our brakes adjusted and we stopped here as they work with Volkswagen. The owner, Greg, is a really nice guy. He had one of his master mechanics checking us right after we got there without appointment. 
The shop is really neat, they fixed our brakes and finally explained us a possible reason why we keep needing our brakes adjusted, and we were good to go.

name: Baked in Belize City
description: We found this nice coffee shop/bakery on the outskirts of town. They serve the best espresso that we could find in Belize City. They sell various types of bread and nice pastries. The atmosphere of the place is real nice.

name: Corozal blues restaurant &resort
description: Oh , the Lady(owner) is very very friendly! And here is super nice!  Actually here is a restaurant & resort, they have a big Garten and behind it , can park few campervan.  We stay 3nichts, all is very clean.  We were really relaxed. U can see photo. 10Belize Dollar

name: Free Wifi at Btl Park
description: Free and fast Wifi at the park. Has parking lots. Slow for downloading Netflix, here.

name: ICB
description: An office of the Insurance Corporation of Belize Ltd. (ICB) and Internet Café. Open daily from 7 am. to 9 pm.

name: Orange Walk Fire Station
description:
We asked at the firefighters if we could take a shower, they have cold water as in all the places we asked and $ 30 BLZ or the price of the room, it does not make sense, in the firefighters you can usually ask for a shower.

Preguntamos en los bomberos si nos prestaban una ducha, tienen agua fría como en todos los lugares que preguntamos y $30 BLZ o el precio de la habitación, no tiene sentido, en los bomberos generalmente puedes preguntar por una ducha.

name: Meat Shop
description:
Freaking cool Meat Shop with a big selection of meat at decent prices all produced in Belize lots of it on their own farm.
Seafood and dairy too.
Walkable from Mana Kai, if you stay there.

Restaurants and business likely get their meat and seafood from here.
This is the place to fill up your freezer.

It is down an alleyway likely hard to spot so check attached pictures for the selection, prices and to see how the entry looks like.

name: Shipyard park
description:
We came to Shipyard because we wanted to know a little more about the mennites, see how they live and basically how much we could see, not much because they are only large lots of crops and their houses, the Gebte is going to a cart is great, we stopped sleeping in the town park, we spent a night more than quiet. I liked it

_____________ Español _________________

Vinimos a Shipyard porque queriamos conocer un poco mas sobre los menonitas, ver como viven y básicamente cuánto podíamos ver, no mucho porque son solo lotes grandes de cultivos y sus casas, la gebte anda a carreta es genial, paramos a dormir en el Parque del pueblo, pasamos una noche mas que tranquila. me gustó

name: bertha's tamales
description: if you are looking for a quick stop for good & cheap lunch, here it is! delicious traditional fresh homemade tamales, ever tried them? only 3b $ and super tasty!

name: Fuel station with tent camping
description: Gas station and small shop where they let cyclists or other tent campers use the grassy yard. Camp behind the fuel tanks to block the highway noise and/or wind. Also a room available to rent. Toilets available, not sure about a shower though. Good Digicell reception, wifi too but I didn't ask for password. I didn't stay here but apparently 2 cyclists did the previous 2 days.

name: money exchange @ SP furniture shop
description: great rate. peso divide by 9, $100USD = 204BLD on 20 Feb 2020

name: Organic Farmers Market
description: awesome stop! only on fridays until around 1pm though and expensive but here you can get organic bread, cheese, vegetables, kombucha, cinnamon buns, bagels, donuts, salsas, cosmetics, cake, aloe vera juice.........

name: Springfield Menonite Village
description: menonite village where they still live very traditional. you'll see horse buggies (with volkswagen suspension) and traditional clothing. interesting to see. also bought some good honey from one of the farmers. friendly people, got many hello waves. the street to get there is a decent dirtroad, just gets quite narrow at some point.

name: Benque Hardware Store
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Coordinates updated, please verify if location is correct, and if so remove this message. 

hardware store u at about a mile or so on the Belize side of border that has many things. We were able to find the small green 1lb propane tanks here for our Coleman stove

name: Salty Life Eco Tours
description: They offer different snorkeling tours. The full day Hol Chan tour is from 9 am. to 3 pm. (all other tour operators start later) and takes you to seven different places. You'll get to snorkel with sharks, rays, turtles, see pristine corals and a shipwreck and, if you are lucky, even manatees. The cost is US$  65 for adults and 55 for kids under 12 and it includes lunch, water, fruit, fees, guides and free GoPro videos and photos. The only thing on the downside was that ‘lunch’ for most of the participants was just a burger (others got a filling lunch box; check that beforehand). Highly recommended!

name: Watina Sports Bar & Grill
description:
Barranco is a super relaxed little village. We stayed for the weekend and loved every minute. You’ll meet pretty much all the residents within a few hours. 

Could pretty much park anywhere within reason, but we met the village council chairman and owner of the only bar, Ras Jerry. He insisted we stay behind his bar next to the village church, just to be sure. Didn’t pay anything but we did buy some beers from him. He has bathrooms too, and let us use his sink to wash up when my water pump shorted out.

We got lucky and arrived on a weekend that they were holding a Garifuna memorial ceremony, so it was great to catch that at the Garifuna temple.

Barranco only has two little tuck shops, so definitely stock up on fresh groceries before you head out. 

WARNING: the road the Barranco from the Punta Gorda junction is not paved, and even though it’s only 25km it took over an hour each direction. Some parts are pretty gnarly, but no 4x4 needed. I took it super slow at ~10mph and had no problems (in my RWD micro-RV).

name: Down the street from Buba Wuba
description: Small dirt pullout. owner unknown. streetlight right out front. stayed 1 night no problem. 21' truck camper fit no problem.

name: Insurance Cooperation of Belize
description: Very friendly, very efficient. 1 week 29 BLZ, 2 weeks 46 BLZ, 4 weeks 60 BLZ. Normal opening times. Sunday closed.

name: Ther‘s Laundry Mat
description:
Laundry service cost BZD14 per load, maybe 2-3kg one load. Very fast washed and dried our stuff in about 2.5h.
Opening hours:
MO-SA 07am to 12am and 1pm to 5pm.

name: El Gran Mestzio
description:
El Gran Mestizo resort is located along New River.  You can rent cabanas or park/camp the night on the flat grass area.  Family run, family friendly.  Very clean and tidy, perfect place to spend a couple of nights.  They offer boat tours up to Mayan temples, bird and bat watching & croc spotting.  Restaurant & Bar. 
Facilities: toilets, showers underconstruction, non-potable water, no hook ups, security, free fast wifi.  Nightly rates $12.50 USD, extra for pool use & electricity. per person

name: Belize  Raptor Center
description: A little rough to get there but we did it with our 27ft RV.Great spot. Very quiet and safe. Large parking lot. Not very level but with a rock or board no problem. Washroom and showers available. Everyday at 1:30pm there is a flight show..This is an awesome place . Please leave a donation.

name: Cerro Maya Ruins
description: Came in after 5 pm, very friendly guard, sold us tickets and let us roam free. It got dark, we didn’t want to drive the really bad dirt road all the way back, so he asked us inside the compound and let us stay for free. ATTENTION: ground is VERY soft, we had to change site twice because of the weight of our car. And MYRIADS of mosquitos! Clean toilets, no other amenities, NO WiFi!

name: Valdez Electronics
description:
Superb service from Chino and his guys. They made light work of my various electrical problems, explained what they were doing as they went (so I can troubleshoot it myself next time), and Chino even came inside the camper and helped me figure out some of the interior electrical issues. Charged me $70Belize for a couple hours of labor and a bunch of replacement bulbs and switches. Can’t complain!

They’re conveniently located across from the only 24hr grocery store in town, too, where I met some expats the night before. You’ll see ‘Hollywood Styles Boutique’ next door, be on the lookout cause they don’t have a sign outside specifying that it’s a mechanic.

Edit: there is a ‘Valdez Auto Center’ a block up the road that does have a sign, but I don’t think there’s any relation.

name: Phillip - Mechanic
description:
Phillip helped us to fix our “check guage” code. 
He is very professional, has many contacts to find whatever you need and is fast and efficient.
We will come back to him when we are back in Belize for sure. 
He will be opening a yard with parts etc at another location too. 
Also a dog lover!

name: Hopkins Smokey Grill
description: Very good food, flavorful and fresh. We haven't been in Belize long, so not sure about relative cheapness. Run by a couple of very friendly nice ladies. Relaxed outdoor seating.

name: Purify Water Refill
description: You can refill your large bottles here. Second place after the curch.

name: Propane Filling Station
description: Fill in your gas bottles.. if you need to buy one, they sell them at Brodie’s at 120 bzn $ or at the u-mall (cheap Asian supermarket) for 99$.

name: Natural Arch
description:
Moderator Note: Beware of the difficulties in visiting this Place. Read description carefully.
.....
Beautiful natural arch. Road is very rough and only accessible during dry season. If it rains you’ll be using your winch several times. I used it once even dry as it is now. You need good 4x4 and experience. You need also a permit you can get at the forestry department in Bemopan or San Ignacio.
No one but you and nature. No services.

name: Rio on Pools
description: Nice place to spend the day. Natural pools. Several sizes. No camping allowed anywhere but in the Agustine / Douglas Silva Camp ground.

name: Bfree
description: Small private reserve in the middle of the Blade reserve. We were directed here by a local friend. You can camp for 15usd pp. They also have cabins. Cold showers and toilets. Walking trails and canoeing available. They also trave a 120ft high bird watch tower Beautiful river to swim. Road is only accessible in dry season, as most places around here.

name: Ferry Crossing
description: Google maps will not take you this way because it doesn’t seem to know there is a ferry crossing, but there is! Much shorter to go this way between corozal and sarteneja

name: Pets R Family Veterinary Clinic
description:
Super friendly (and cheapest) vet in town. We needed a health certificate for our cat and called 3 different vets in San Ignacio.  Pets R Family had by far the best price (40 BZD total, 20 per consultation and 20 for the health certificate). The others wanted 75 or 90 BZD.

The doctor actually took his job seriously and checked our cat and his papers thoroughly. Highly recommended!

**New Address: 11th Street, San Ignacio Across the street from Tai Kong, By Bocas Restaurant, close to the traffic lights **

name: peers place
description:
nice place to grab real coffee on a Sunday morning, very nice ambience, good WiIFI, next to the beach.

ask before camping overnight

name: Log Cab-Inn
description:
Log Cab-Inn is close to the border and offers Covid-19 Gold Standard. We (2 people, 7m motorhome) booked it for 3 nights just before crossing into Belize and got the necessary confirmation within 15min. Although it has not many flat spots for big rigs, we found one just bellow the restaurant. Many spots for tents and smaller vehicles, though - 30B$/night. Pool shower only. Try the chicken curry, it's delicious.
+501-824-3367

name: SMART speednet SIM cards
description: They sell SIM cards for 15 bzd. Comes with 600MB valid for 3 days. You can recharge / prepay any amount you want.

name: Belize Bank ATM
description:
Parking was a zoo at the ATM just around the corner. Chill to park just around the corner, down the side street.
Fee is $3.50 + 1% of the withdrawn amount

name: Lamanai River Tours
description: Stayed here (for free) after we took a boat tour with them to the Lamanai Maya Ruins. Friendly an helpful owner, took us also to the next tire shop to get our flat tire fixed.

name: Casa Ricky’s
description:
You can park at Casa Rickys , van or small tent in the parking area.. 
You can plug in and use a shower. 
Contact ricky, we stayed in a room.
Ricky is an easy going guy. 

You can book, www.casarickys.com
WhatsApp: +5016343759

name: Quiet dirt track
description: Just a spot on a grassy stretch of dirt road (wide enough to let a tractor pass us) leading to fields (not towns) to sleep one silent night. (After visiting Altún Ha, we decided to drive (on muddy farmer's tracks: 4x4 recommended) away from the hamlet Santana until we found a spot that's obviously not private property.) We've seen one car at sunset but heard nobody all night. Poor DigiCell reception.

name: Florida Beach Camping
description:
Located just before the Old Marina (coming from Belize City) this place offers camping for overlanders. There is a small RV-sign next to a small building on the road and the entry might be closed with a chain. Just walk in and ask for Alice - the lovely owner that lives here with her daughters. She charged us 25B$ per night. There is WiFi, water, toilets and a private beach. You may hike through the shallow water back to the Coast Guard or over to the marina.
Great place to leave your rig (and dogs) when visiting the city or the cayes. A bit run down and simple but has everything you need and you help a widow by staying there instead of the noisy marina...

name: DigiNet
description:
Here you can get a prepaid sim card for Belize. Don’t forget your passport. 

SIM card and activation fee is 22.50 b$

name: Carribean Tires and oil change
description:
Spare parts, tires and oil change shop. 
They changed our motor oil (2.5 gallons of high quality oil) for about 55 US $. Quick service and nice guys. 

They were really interested in our journey and van. We got a little service gift (because we are travellers).

name: Cahal Pech Maya Ruins
description: Beautiful and small maya ruins. Enter fee is about 10 BZ$ per Person. We went there on Monday morning and we were almost alone.

name: Placencia Health Center
description:
We get there a free tetanus vaccine shot after my wife stept on a sting ray. Friendly stuff, quick, free and good. 

I think they don’t vaccine against covid but you can do your PCR or rapid Test there.

name: Ice N Beans
description: Very good bagels, cinnamon rolls, donuts etc…. Also good cold and warm drinks. You can chill in the hammocks and enjoy good food. Fast wifi.

name: Franchie‘s Diving Service
description:
Scuba diving or padi dive courses. 440 US$ for the padi open water license.  This school is recommended by the locals. 
WhatsApp: +501 663-7772

name: COVID Test Booth
description: This is the COVID Test booth. 50USD/100B per person. Required for anyone older than 5. Friendly bunch of kids working the booth. They did take VISA when we were here but the machine had some connectivity issues.

name: Shopping Area
description: This is the spot we parked, but there are quite a few grocery stores/ liquor stores in this area to replenish stocks after crossing the border and moving on. Seems expensive, veggies not great, but happy to find it if you cross on a Sunday like us.

name: San Ignacio Community Hospital
description: We got our COVID booster shot here. Clearly we are tourists but no questions asked and very nice and friendly staff. See picture for what vaccines are administered...

name: Island Breeze Bar and Grill
description: Really good cheap restaurant. We ordered one fish burger and one conche ceviche and 2 cocktails and we paid 51$bz. Lots of things on the menu: tacos, quesadillas, burger, chicken, stew etc and many many cocktails. Lots of locals and nice music.

name: Erva’s Restaurant
description: A great place where we had a delicious fish (baracuda), very big plate and very good. The owner is very nice and welcoming, everything was perfect. We recommend it very much !

name: Deep River Forest Reserve
description:
The roads in this reserve don't seem to go anywhere nor be used for anything, so absolutely zero traffic.  From the main highway you'll see a sign for the reserve, turn down the dirt road.  you'll pass a small lake (probably also good for camping, but I preferred more seclusion). Some distance on the main dirt road will turn left, to the right is a wide overgrown track with solid terrain that I ended up camping on. 

in the dry season the road to this point was fine, past here was heavily rutted so high clearance (and possibly 4x4) needed. There is a clear stream a short distance on if you need fresh water, but no convenient pullout spots near it so I backtracked to here.  

not many mosquitos,  some biting flies though.  Nothing else can be heard but crickets and birdsong.

name: Beck’s Bed & Breakfast
description: This place is known as a bed and breakfast, but Robert has offered his land to overlanders, as well. He and his wife Becky are the kindest hosts. They don’t have a set charge, but we paid $10 BZD for one night. We were able to use the bathroom and shower in an unoccupied cabin. There is also WiFi available that was strong enough to upload a video. We walked to the pool deck to use it. If you need anything, I’m sure Robert will do his best to accommodate you—he’s that kind of person. Because of where his land is located in Crooked Tree, it doesn’t get boggy during the rainy season like locations that are right on the water.

name: The Iguana Stop
description: The Iguana Stop is a restaurant on the Belize River, offering overnight parking to overlanders. We stopped for a delicious lunch and really loved the setting on the river. Important: WhatsApp the owner Justin at 610-6216 before coming to camp (Belize number). This is an active restaurant with limited parking during operating hours. They will accommodate you, but it might take some advance planning. Okay, now the details. The restaurant/bar is open Thursday/Friday from 5-9 pm and Saturday/Sunday from to 12-9 pm (the bar will stay open later). If you want to camp when the restaurant is closed, that’s okay. You just have to contact Justin. There are large men/women restrooms. There is WiFi. They can run an extension cord outside for electricity. There is a large palapa if it’s raining. And a water spigot should be available soon for dishwashing, etc. There is also a pontoon boat for tours down the Belize River (again, talk to Justin for details and to arrange). The price per night is $10 USD or $20 BZD. Fun place to see wildlife: iguanas, crocodiles, etc. We asked Justin if he could accommodate larger RVs, and he said yes if the restaurant isn’t open.

name: Davis Falls 4x4 Permit & Trailhead
description: Here you can ask in the Grocery Store to buy a permit to drive the 4x4 route to Davis Falls. It was free for ua because of Covid bit normally they charge. Awesome track, crossing several creeks. At the end you have to walk about 2 miles to get to the falls (2nd highest in Belize). Only possible when dry, as its a muddy track in some parts. Just follow the main track until the end to the parking lot. 4x4 and high clearance needed.

name: Karel's Cool Spot
description: Very good spot to have lunch. We had two dishes and a drink fro 20 Belize Dollar. Delicious and the owner is super friendly.

name: Belize river
description: A place near the belize river acces easy decent phone signal very calm

name: Small area beside river
description:
Free! Small pullout beside river. Suitable for smaller vehicles only, perhaps short wheelbase sprinter or pickup camper at max. Not exactly level ground but it's not bad either and if you have leveling blocks you'd be fine.

No amenities. But, it's quiet, metres from the river, there was a nice breeze and, as if by magic, we had no bugs. Slept with windows open in the middle of wet season and didn't even see a single mosquito. Was the best thing about it Hehe.

It is somewhat private: It's off the road a little way but it can be seen by cars who are driving past the entrance. Initially we didn't feel super safe because cars were driving past and several of them slowed right down to look at us, and two vehicles came by multiple times, the occupants staring each time. However, no one bothered us and after about 10pm there were no more cars.

name: Masaja Park
description:
We spent 3 quiet nights, it is very safe, nobody bothered us, on the contrary, there are people who came to say hello and gave us mangoes. There is a man on a bicycle who passes by in the afternoon to sell bread, they are very good if you see him you have to try it.

Pasamos 3 noches tranquilas, es muy seguro, nadie nos molestó, al contrario hay personas que se acercaron a saludar y nos regalaron mangos. Hay un señor en bicicleta que pasa por las tardes a vender pan, son muy ricos, si lo ves tienes que probarlo.

name: Oil station San pablo
description:
There is clean water and toilets.

Hay agua y baños limpios.

name: Beach
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because City Ordinance Prohibits camping within city limits. Signs posted and enforced

name: Barton Creek Archaeological Reserve
description:
They don't allow camping here. You have to pay Mike's place or parking free overnight next to bridge. Excursion to the cave $65USD.

No se puede pasar la noche aquí. Tienes que acampar en mike's camping o a lado del puente gratis pero te permiten estar todo el día dentro del parque, no nos cobraron la entrada, hay baños. Para el tour a la cueva son $65USD se nos hizo caro para nuestro presupuesto así que continuamos el viaje.

name: Acosta's Home
description: Free access to my wifi. 40 Mbps. Just stop and honk and I will be happy to assist you with the password. Send me a whatsapp at 5016638060.

name: Yim Saan Hotel
description: Clean, well-run hotel on the edge of Belmopan. Large parking area. Chinese restaurant. Rooms with A/C, hot showers, balcony. One bed B$90, two for B$120. Chinese restaurant. There’s no prominent signage, so look for the large Invictus building; the hotel is next door.

name: branch creek jungle lodge
description:
This place offers different kind of trips from cave exploring to jungle survival trips for days. we did the cave waterfall which was a great experience. We contacted the place to see if we could sleep in the parking lot (sort or middle in the jungle) and they offered us a room (I wouldn't expect it to happen every time) 
Very friendly staff and willing to help. the restaurant serves really good food, not super cheap (about 32USD for dinner per person) but we would definetly recommend.
I think they would allow camping in the parking area when you book a tour. doesn't fit big rigs

name: Sandbar
description:
Very good place, you can cook your own food and have a refrigerator for you.
Also get the water you want for free. In front of the beach and near center. Highly recomended

name: Puma Gas Station
description: After filling up on diesel, we asked if we could stay for the night because we didn’t want to drive in the dark. The nice Lady at the cashier called the boss, yes, no problem at all. The gas station closes at 9 pm and opens again at 6 am. We were directed to a nice green spot behind a fence in the back of the station. Safe, quiet, had a good night’s sleep. VERY nice and friendly staff, they were actually delighted that foreign tourists didn’t just fill up the tank and went their way, but want wanted to stay and chat, especially with our truck :-) Toilets for 1 BZ$ available as long as the gas station is open.

name: San Miguel Campground
description: Nice campground in the middle of the woods next to big rock falls. toilets and showers available. the place is new, only open for 1 year now. very nicely done. the owner Philip is very nice and helpful. price 30bzd pP and night. direct access to big rock falls as well as some private pools in the river only accessible from the campsite. wifi not yet available but will come soon. highly recommended place!

name: MC Customz Garage
description:
Motorcycle mechanic named Daniel. He does most almost everything on motorcycles. 
Very reasonable price.

name: Five Blues Lake National Park
description: Five Blues Lake National Park Has some neat history behind it, Apparently the lake has drained twice in the past several years, And it didn’t drain slowly, it drained in about 2 days or so. It is full right now. There are also some small caves that we explored. They are very neat! They go from one opening to another connecting them by tunnels/caves between them. In the wet season you would defininitely want 4wd with good clearance. There are a couple of rivers you have to cross as well.

name: Wild camp
description:
End Road next beach house. FREE 
so much trash, but good for one night. 
we spend all day and one night, no problem, no police, nobody came.

name: creme de la creme
description: Creme de la creme. Ice cream and drinks shop with parking spaces. surrounded by a nice park with music playing until 10pm. toilet available during opening hours for 1 Belize dollar. able to use benches and bring own alcohol. we had our tables outside our vans and they were ok with it. we spoke to the owner Raul who was lovely, he is very keen for overlanders to stay and is also planning on constructing showers for maybe a small fee. overlooked by the police station, feels safe. there is also brilliant WiFi from the restaurant if you order something and it reaches the vans.

name: shipstern nature reserve
description:
Beautiful place to visit with children. Butterflies, Visitor Center, jungle trail and observation tower.
——
Bel endroit à visiter avec des enfants. Papillons, Centre des visiteurs, sentier dans la jungle et tour d'observation.

name: crystal water
description: You can buy 20l here for 4.50 blz dollars.

name: Vista del mar guesthouse
description:
cheap and really good place!
50bzd for double room. some with private bathroom and some with shared bathroom (all very clean). fan and fridge inside. shared kitchen with free fruits and cookies. also have a really good WiFi. owner very nice!

name: Blue Bird Rooms
description:
The Blue Bird are rooms on the upstairs floor of a family house.

We are so happy we found out about Ramon and Malaine's home.

The upper floor is dedicated to the rental rooms. 
We are staying in a cosy and comfortable room with a double bed and a fan. 
We paid BZ$ 200 for the week for the two of us.

Rooms are also rented daily for BZ$ 45 /pers, add BZ$15 for an extra pers.

The entire space is kept clean, with a spacious kitchen with fridge, stove, microwave and basic cooking utensils, even a toaster.

A large porch on the front.
Parking inside the closed front yard.

Reese, the oldest daughter, is very sweet and also answered our questions.

Wi-Fi is fairly stable.
The common bathroom has cold shower, it was just fine with the hot weather.

The house is located in a calm residential area, there may be noise with the neighbors dogs but it did not bother us.

A 5 minute drive to the Mayan ruins of Cahal Pech.

The downtown area is 10-15 mini e walk.
There are supermarkets just a couple minute walk away.

Jsut call Ramon or Malaine for more info.

Ramon whatsapp: +501 665 5205
Malaine whatsapp: +501 624 4576

name: oasis ranch
description:
Call ahead:  +501 600 45 38
We met Gladys and Alfredo in town, they spontaneously offered to come and sleep at their place. They have a farm with cows, goats, chickens. They spoiled us with fruit and especially information about Belize and their culture.  A wonderful exchange.  We were even invited to eat at their place after a walk in the jungle to explain the local fauna and flora to us.  An incredible encounter!!!  They do not ask for money and yet they need it, especially for the studies of their three boys, do not hesitate to leave them a little something to help them.

Nous avons rencontré Gladys et aflredo en ville, ils nous ont proposé spontanément de venir dormir chez eux, ils ont une ferme avec des vaches, des chèvres , des poules.. Ils nous ont gâté de fruits et surtout d'informations sur le Belize et leur culture. Un magnifique échange. Nous avons même été invité à manger chez eux après une balade dans la jungle pour nous expliquer la faune et flore locale. Une rencontre incroyable !!! Ils ne demandent pas d'argent et pourtant ils en ont besoin, notamment pour les études des leurs trois garçons, n'hésitez pas à leur laisser un petit quelque chose pour les aider.

name: Altun Ha Ruins
description: Nice and well preserved Mayan ruins. You're allowed to climb to all buildings, you can also visit a pond a short walk away trough the jungle. Little museum with interesting information regarding the region and the old town social structure. The entrance is 10bz pp for non residents. The place is clean and well taken care of, free parking (outside of the arqueological area), clean bathrooms, guide service is offered (we didn't ask the price), and small souvenir shops on site.

name: Community Baboon Sanctuary/Visitor Center
description:
The Howler Monkey Sanctuary known as the Community Baboon Sanctuary (CBS), it's a great place to visit if you'll like to see Howler Monkeys on their natural habit. 
What makes this place special is that the Monkeys are not kept within a reserve or closed area, they are scattered around the jungle within several small villages. 

Now the specifics: 
Monkey Adventure 20bz/10usd, 30 to 60min
We did this one, our guide led us trough the jungle close by the Visitor Center, he told us some information about the fauna and flora around, don't be afraid of asking questions, as he is looking around and calling for the Monkeys he is not focused on other things. We walked for about 40min with no success but our guide did not give up, he took us back to a spot he thought they would be at, and there they were. He called them closer and we had the opportunity to get a great photo out of it, please keep in mind that they are wild animals and you should not get to close or touch them, your guide will let you observe them for a couple minutes and make sure you have a good shot and than ask you kindly to return. 

Canoeing/Kayaking 60bz/30usd pp, 90-120min

Croc Night Adventure 110bz/55usd pp (min 2p), 120min

Night hike 40bz/20usd pp, 90min

Bird tour 60bz/30usd pp

The Kriol Experience from 300bz/150usd pp, 30-60min 

Remember to take cash with, although they have a sign on the door saying that they accept cards, this is currently not available. 

More information can be found on their website:
https://www.howlermonkey.org/

name: Pull off
description: Little pull off next to the road, close to an antenna. Not so much noise from the road at night but it starts around 5am.

name: Guanacaste National Park
description: Beautiful little park. Two hiking loops in the jungle, one about 45min, other about 15mins. Great to spot wildlife, specially birds, and very nice views of the Belize river. Small visitor center on site with clean bathrooms and picnic area. Entrance fee is 5bzd per person, it goes to maintenance of the place. Friendliest staff ever, we ended up chatting for almost an hour.

name: Cheap gas station for trucks and buses
description: You can come here and buy gas at a cheaper price than any other place in Belize (about 1 by dollar less)

name: Sugarfix Bakery + Wifi
description: Good bakery with an outdoor sitting and an indoor sitting. Located in a quite street where you can easily park for free. They have free wifi working good, good coffee and pastries

name: Evarista & Silvanus
description:
Amazing experience in the Mayan community with Evarista and Silvanus. 
In nature, in the beautiful land filled with the flowers of Evarista, surrounded by fruit trees and beautiful palapa built in the tradition by Silvanus and members of the community. 

We were invited here by Raphael, a passionate ranger we met at the Blue Hole National Park. 

We are learning so much about the very alive Mayan community, their traditions and the positives and negatives of modernism. 

The family gave us the most incredible experience we had in Belize. Eva cooked typical Mayan food for us while Nus took us on an adventurous hike through the jungle to farm on the steep mountainside and down by the creek under the dense canopy he cut through with his machete. 

Call Raphael at +501 629 6958.

name: Maya King Waterfalls
description:
Parking lot of the Maya King Waterfalls. We asked at the entrance for permission to stay overnight. They said it’s OK without further fee. Gate of the park is closed in night. Only few tourists visiting this site and after 5 PM nobody visited the place. Perfect quiet night.

Entrance fee of the park is 10 US $ pp.

name: Blease Villa Suites
description:
3 AirBnB Suites, with living and kitchenettes. Currently at $100, $50, and $40 USD. 
Check on airbnb or come say hello in person for availability.
Camping and restaurant available.

name: Next to Benito‘s Ground
description:
Cleared piece of land with beach access, next to a fenced property. Absolutely beautiful.
Make sure to go over and ask the caretaker Benito for his consent. He is a jewel of a human. He might even let you stay on his property right on the beach for free. 
You can see Chetumal, a ton of stars and hear the jungle inhabitants during the night.
Cell signal is spotty and sometimes telcel from Mexico available.
Big rigs possible. The road is doable with a 2wd if its dry, but not easy bc of ground clearance. After rain I wouldn’t recommend it without 4x4, since it was more of a dirt road that tends to get muddy badly.
It seems they gonna improve it soon with the chinese money.

name: Nim Li Punit
description: Mayan Ruins.  $10 Bz pp.  Small, but well marked, with a nice little museum.  Washrooms

name: cherry's good food
description: small Restaurant, just 8 seats inside, people there were really friendly, food was great and price was local price (8 belize dollars for the food for one person), we can recommend this place and would come back!

name: Agua Clara
description:
Ray, the caretaker is a sunshine! (:
He opened up his 'not- finished-yet' 𝚎𝚌𝚘 𝚙𝚊𝚛𝚔  for us (25$ pp) 
Perfectly clean shower, new wall,  painted toilets, private blue- green riverfront, beautiful garden, palapas, fire pits, „instagram worthy“ garden swing, cabanas to rent and freshly made football, baseball and beach volleyball -field/playing area (if you have kids)
The wifi is going strong too
Place to stay for a couple of days- to reset and refresh <3
(Restaurant is coming up)

name: Belize Museum
description:
Belize Museum entrance fee 7 Us $ Person.

not worth the money at the moment.

The exhibition with the Mayas will be redesigned.

The exhibition about slavery has not enought light to read, so the receptionist has to bring a torch.

name: Belmopan Civic Center
description:
100 meters far from the headquarter of the Belize Police is a big Parking lot. We ask the police and they said it's a very secure place in town 
We were sent away from the place near ministry of foreign affairs. 

At the other side of the road is also 24 h security

name: Corkers Restaurant and bar
description:
at the second floor of the hotel you can sit outside or inside. meals starting from 10 b$ till 60 b$

they have draft beer.

food is delicious. all plates on other tables looked very appetizing

name: Tranquility Beach Suites
description:
Tranquility Beach Suites is a newly opened hotel with a secluded parking area open to small camper Vans. Parking is allowed for up to 2 days, a water hose is available to fill up tanks and a contribution for use is appreciated, water has a cost of 1 cent a gallon.

There is a pool shared with the Suites that is open to respectful travelers as well as the beach and beach loungers.

The parking is shared with the rest of the accommodations, so no open bathing, laundry hanging is allowed.

there is a lawn towards the back where you are welcome to use out and enjoy nature.
there are many fruit trees on the property and you are welcome to take some.
please contact Carolina before arrival, +501 613-4802

name: TJ supermarket
description: Nice new supermarket, modern, well stocked with everything you might need

name: Mango walk inn
description:
Cabanas in the jungle near a river. 4X4 mandatory, very bad road, but clean, quiet place
-------------
Cabanas dans la jungle proche d'une rivière. 4X4 OBLIGATOIRE trés mauvais chemin, mais endroit propre, calme

name: Local market
description: Fresh fruit and vegetables. Also ice cream and free wifi. Toilets

name: Fast food local
description: Burger. Chicken fingers. French fried. Very cheap for Belize and good. Open Monday Tuesday Thursday and Friday.

name: Paradise cafe. Ice cream
description: Frappuccino and ice cream. Good wifi too

name: Bakery and deli
