description: Waouw. Very good American pastries. She does also whole bread. Fresh cinnamon rolls. Amazing place never seen in Central America. Love it

name: Atlantic bank atm (no fee 2023)
description: atm with interac plus sign.  It let us get max withdraw limit for our canadian debit card.  Zero fees and no percentage upcharge.

name: tortilleria, restaurant and Scarlet Mccaw tours Angelita Acal
description:
An incredibly friendly woman who sells delicious homemade tortillas as well as will make you traditional foods with some advance notice (prefers 1 day).
They are a local indigenous family that will be happy to have you camp, feed you, or show you the Scartle Mccaws when they are around.  

call Angelita +501 653 4558

name: market
description:
next to the soccer field
Saturday morning market
local producers and crafts

name: Purified Water Quench Ur Thirst
description:
This purified water shop is owned by Sabodi. Very kind and honest, very very very cheap water. Super interested in travellers, and dream to go to Ireland visit one day so Irish travellers he will love you. 

We found the place on googlemaps and showed up. It looked closed but we asked and neighbors told us to knock, Sabodi was in his house just next door. He came out and nicely opened the water house to refill our jerrycans. It was already night and we had no plan for the night so he even offered us to sleep in front of his house. We would never have asked but the offer was so nice we accepted. 

Highly recommended !

name: free shower at the beach
description: there is a free shower at the beach, maybe it is from the near hotel

name: Carrys Kitchen
description: A running family restaurant in an big blue house. It’s open from Wednesday to Saturday til 9pm. You sit in the garage and see the owner during cooking. She is sooo friendly, the food very delicious and the prices are really fair and cheap. Very good quality!

name: River Beach - Motorcycles only
description:
Little sandy beach/peninsula in Swasey River, good for tents. Small track off the gravel road becomes single track accessible by motorbike, bicycle and on foot. Park on the bank and pitch a tent on the beach. 

Small fire leftovers and orange peel are evidence that locals come here sometimes. 

The river is good for a swim and the place is idyllic.

No phone reception to speak of

name: River Bank by Ford
description:
The dirt road fords the river at a shallow section. You can camp on the river Bank to the right. In the dry season big parts of the river are also dry and you can camp on those.
Perfect for motorcycles and tents, and 4x4 camping. There is space for small campers (less so in the wet season) but beware that a lot of it is loose sand and stones so I recommend walking it before you drive in. In the dry 2x4s should make it. (The dirt road in has some drive-in-drive-out type holes and ruts that can have mud.)

Idyllic place for swimming, camp fires and a few trees for shade. Little fish and tadpoles in the water. Lots of birds.

Locals came in the early evening to swim and wash their car in the ford. One car used the Ford after dark. But they just left us to it.

Mobile phone reception with data works mostly.

name: Bay Breeze Apartments
description:
Chilled out apartments just outside of town.
Private: your room, kitchen, bathroom (en suite), dining room and porch area.
Shared: upstairs roof terrace with sun deck, bbq area and seating area, bicycles included.

name: Scarlett Macaw Camping Site
description: A safe campground for campers from around the world. Camping fee is $10 USD per person. Easy access to the camping area.

name: Tropical Butterfly Farm / House
description:
Very nice butterfly house. The owner is really nice and passionate about his work. You can enter the butterfly house and observe these beauties. They are not shy at all and you can see and potograph them from very close. At the moment there are 12 different butterflies and catepillars in all shape and colors. :-) 
If you‘re lucky, you can even see them hatch. 
Was a very cool experience for us, even we aren‘t the big butterfly fans. 
Costs: BZD 10 per person

There is a parking where the Maya souvenier shop and the chocolate factory is (there is also a toilet free to use).

name: CCAN Laundry & Lifestyle
description:
Laundry where you can bring your laundry and pick it up later or do it by yourself. It‘s really small with only a few machines, but the only one we found in town. 

Price: BZD 6.— per load wash and also BZD 6.— per load dryer

We did our own for $12bz wash and dry, one load.

name: Amir’s marina
description:
Beautiful place at the water's edge, starting point for the boat to Lamanai.  Tour carried out by Amir who welcomes you here (he does not live there)… the welcome is warm, toilets and water available.  If you chat with the neighbors you will even have access to wifi!  The place is secured by Fidèle, the person in charge of Amir's marina. FREE
---
Bel endroit au bord de l’eau, lieu de départ en bateau pour Lamanai. Tour effectué par Amir qui vous accueille ici (il n’habite pas la)… l’accueil est chaleureux, toilette et eau à disposition. Si vous discutez avec les voisins vous aurez même l’accès au wifi ! Le lieu est sécurisé par Fidèle, la personne en charge de la marina d’Amir. GRATUIT

name: Ice and water factory
description: good place to fill potable water. was open on sunday. it has signs from the main road, easy to find.

name: Aquatic Premium Purified Water
description: Very good place to get your water. Parking at the street is very convenient. BZ$3 for 6 gallons of water.

name: Gale‘s Point
description: Very nice peninsula, we found this site without any signs, we came here and decided to stay one night. Very soon some girls came along and told us the place is free of charge, it belongs to nobody. No problem to stay here over night. Many children came along and asked for sweets. We had a calm evening. Than a girl named Sheridan came and offered some chains and told us she needs some money for her kids…. . We know these stories but anyway we bought 2 chains for 10 Belize $. She also offered a boat tour for next day to see the Manatees for 35 Belize $ per person. We agreed. Next morning a very angry guy came along and told us he is the owner of this place and we have to pay him 15 US$ for sleeping here. We discussed with him that there are no signs and we offered 10 Belize$. He screamed on us and threatened to call the police. We said no problem and he went away and didn‘t came back. Later we made the boat-tour with Sheridan and Listan the owner of the boat, the tour took not 1 hour, we didn‘t see any Manatees, but ok, we wanted to pay them the 70 Belize $! But at the end Sheridan wanted 70 US instead of Beöize $ and she got very angry because we didn‘t pay that. We left that place after that. So if you go there, be very careful and don‘t belive anything people tell you!!

name: St. Herman‘s Blue Hole National Park
description:
Entrance fee to the park is $ 8 Belize. You can do nice hikes here. I went into the St. Herman’s Cave for the first 183 meters and did the Jungle Trail. Also I went to the hole (it‘s a cenote) for a swim in crystal clear water.
Guided tours are available on site at the park entrance starting 9 am, minimum 2 persons: 50 USD for the complete St. Herman‘s Cave (2.5 hrs, length from entrance to exit is more than 2 km), 50 USD for cave tubing (2.5 hrs) and 100 USD for the Crystal Cave (5-6 hrs.).
However, there are other companies offering the guided tours, too.

name: Westrac Auto Parts and Services
description:
Very supportive staff in trying to find the right part for my imported Mercedes Sprinter.
I needed a rubber boot for the joint of the front wheel. No VIN or parts number available. 
He found a fitting part after even crawling under my car for having a close look at the part to be replaced.

name: Universal Hardware
description: Free open WiFi at Universal Hardware store

name: Corozal Bay Beach park
description: The park has a grassy area where you can park tge car and swim and kayak in the lake. Checked with couple of locals they said it was all safe. if you are in fishing, you van catch snapper and cat fish in the bay. on some weekend there are activities  in the park so it may not be available. local will welcome you to their city and glad to shate info. Make sure to ask them. All along the bay if it's not public property, it's  safe

name: Beach front
description: The whole beachfront is safe. I like this spit as there is shade around in the afternoon. The only drawback is that there is a restaurant nearby that has loud music until midnight. if you get a drink you can access the internet. At night you may find a couple of drunk lurking around the beach too. They do not bother anyone. WiFi is a restaurant if you purchase a drink there.

name: Kajin's Döner Kebab
description: Real German Döner Kebab! Opened in 2023, the first Kebab in Belize owned by Germans. Very good and fair prices. Open from 11-8pm. Closed on Sunday

name: Hobbs Brewing-The Brew Barge
description: Craft brewery and restaurant. Great food and beer. This is the best craft beer in Central America. They brew across the street and have many styles, we tried them all, not a loser in the bunch. The prices are consistent with US prices. The carry out cans are very pricey in our opinion, but if you value good beer and want some to go, I guess you pay their prices. We had the sliders, onion rings, and conch fritters, all were good. Great service, friendly staff. Good vibe here, worth checking out. They also have a sister brewery in New Hampshire.

name: Sting Ray feeding station
description:
Everyday at 5:30 pm they feed the sting ray here
 you can join the fun and feed and touch them under supervision.

name: H&H Gas station
description: The gas station has air and water tap next to the fence by the road. RV's can connect their hose

name: French Croissant Belize
description: French Bakery, the only authentic French boulangerie in Belize. Amazing croissants, amazing bread: sourdough, french baguette, five grain, artisanal bread and a huge selection of cookies and sweets. And THE best SANDWICHES!!!!!!

name: El Chiclero Inn
description:
Good hotel in the centre of Burrell Boom.
Very spacious rooms with ac, fridge , coffee, nice hot/cold showers,swimming pool, good wifi.  They serve really good food and there is a supermarket at 200 m.
The hotel has a new owner since a year and they are still improving.

Elvis runs the hotel and he has a tour company as well. 
They don’t have a website yet.  
+501 622 7854
Info@elchicleroinn.com
Elvis Lamanai tours +5016381946

We were here by bike with the three of us and had a room with two double beds.  The normal price was 175 belizian .  May be you can ask Elvis for a better rate.  ;-)

name: city Council Park
description:
Great palapa Park where you can park your rug on the beach and enjoy beautiful  Belize
Access to this park may be restricted to vans and SUV. on weekend the park may be crowded
 During the day nice and tranquil

name: Beach Access
description: Stayed here for a night. Looks like it's a wild empty lot next to Hopkins Resort. I had seen some locals accessing the beach during the day. I came in the evening and parked the car and camped out. A little bit of grass has grown along the beach but not bad. Very quiet and peaceful at night.

name: Lighthouse Parking
description: Large parking lot by the sea that can accommodate large RVs. Near the pier for the islands. Small snack bar just opposite. Quiet and secure place.

name: Habib restaurant
description: if you love Lebanese food, this place is legit. Really enjoyed the food. Habibi.platter was out of the world. $28BZ. I have added menu too. Enjoy!!!

name: Lost Reef Resort
description:
Small resort on the beach with cabanas  and the possibility to pitch your tent under the palm trees right at the beach. Hidden gem ! 
There is a swimming pool, a restaurant with good food for reasonable prices. Restrooms, showers and very good wifi.
We paid $25 belizian dollars for one tent p/night

We came here by bicycle. Gorgeous place !

name: bella's Backpacker Hostel
description: Great Hostel. stayed three nights here. Great vibrant. Nice owner and help. let me park thr car in the front too. very safe area.

name: smokey Joe Gas Station
description: last gas station before you head to Caracol. They have bottled fuel that you can use to fill your tank. Look for small sign on the pillar. It's a regular tied on right of road that sells gas

name: ATM at Atlantic Bank
description: Just an operational ATM on the right side of the Atlantic Bank's entrance. No local fée.

name: Bay View hotel
description:
Simple but good, clean and affordable hotel in Belize City. Wifi, AC, shower. 
Restaurants and little stores in neighborhood. Close to the seafront which is not very spectacular here in BC.
300 m from the hotel is an traditional Indian restaurant with gorgeous food.

Double room with AC 95
Single 80

name: Parrots Peak
description:
Welcome to Parrots Peak – our mountaintop home.
We were overlanders, so we designed with you in mind!
•	Newly built
•	Gorgeous mountain views in the middle of the jungle
•	Private swimming pool
•	Electricity
•	Hot water sink & shower
•	Wifi
•	Minutes from the Guatemala border - Just 2 miles above the village
        of San Jose Succotz
•	Limited dumping, but upgrading
•	$40 BZ per night, per vehicle
DO NOT FOLLOW YOUR GPS THROUGH THE VILLAGE – IT WILL LEAD YOU HORRIBLY ASTRAY - FOLLOW THE MAP IN PHOTOS

Call ahead or email:
Keebfam1@gmail.com
If the gate is closed – honk & shout. If we’re not home – hang out a while – we’ll be back before dark.

name: Warrie Head resort
description:
Good restaurant at the Warrie Head resort. 
We had a delicious lunch on a beautiful terrace between the trees and birds.  Friendly staff.

We didn’t stay here for the night but they rent cabanas as well.

name: Namaste Café | Yoga Class
description:
Yoga during the week every morning at 8am on donation basis. 
Also a really nice Café with delicious breakfast.

name: The Crimson Orchid Inn, Orchid Bay
description:
One of the most beautiful locations that we have parked up in yet on our Pan-American trip. We parked up at Stephen’s Inn for the night and not only got to see the most stunning sunset over the Caribbean from his roof top bar and keel billed Tucans but also got to enjoy delicious pizza as we arrived on Saturday night which is pizza night. (Fri nights too)
Truly a paradise location. Feels like a 5* hotel and not a park up spot. 
This is a gated community and feels super safe. You also have access to the swimming pool and a beautiful beach. 
 Current price is 10$ Belizean per night per person 
If you want to treat yourself indulge in Stephen’s breakfast for only $15 Belizean
Wi-Fi is great
There’s also lovely clean toilets with toilet roll and running water in the sink

name: Klaasen Camp
description:
A nice area, right on the water with loads of space for camping in tents and vehicles. They also rent little huts, but didn't ask for the price. There is a big semi-open communal area with chairs, tables and a lot of covered space to hang out or escape the rain / sun. Bathrooms and showers are big and would be nice, but needed a cleaning when we were here. There's a boat ramp, a little beach and a fireplace available as well.

Overall the place feels a bit like a summer camp setup judging by the size and amount of chairs. Israel, the manager, is a really friendly guy, even came by later to bring us coffee.

Price: He asked for 25 BZN per Person which we told hil was too much for us, so he offered us 15 bzn which for the nice place is good value we thought.

No electricity, no wifi, probably cell reception (don't have a sim card for belize yet, but there is a 4G roaming signal.

name: Blease Villa Camping and Suits
description:
Andrea has an airbnb with nice rooms, but also you can park your rv or car in or outside the gate of the house and hook to electricity + nice toilets (very clean with sits!) + hot and cold shower to use, tables and benches outside to use, nice grassy area to put a tent if you want and a small inflatable pool.
Andrea and the whole family are the nicest there is and spending time with them is great! highly reccomend to sleep here, nice and comfortable and we paid 10 usd in total (2 people in an rv) 
Better to contact before- ‎Sitna (the daughter) +5016136372
Andrea- +5016106471

name: Dzib Wilderness
description: Clean Environment, Plenty of shade from fruit trees such as; Coconut, Mangos, Sour soup, Mahogany Trees and Ceiba Tree to name a few.  Cell Phone Coverage, vehicle access and 10 minutes walking distance to superstore.

name: Insurance Corp of Belize
description: $29 BLZ ($15 US) for a week. I was told a month is $34 BLZ.

name: Mattress factory
description: Perfect spot to buy a new custom made mattress for a good price!

name: Brewed awakenings
description: Great seaweed smoothies air conditioner and wifi. Also they have card games to play. Smoothies for 10 blz

name: Casa Cycloviajeros Familia Rivas
description:
This is a family house where the host, Rigo Rivas, will happily let you camp or park in the front yard, there are no gates or barriers, but it is super safe. Rigo organizes a network of travelers and hosts from Belize to Panamá, so if you plan to go that way this is a nice spot to get those connections.

They shared their wifi password and the signal is good in the yard, drinkable tap water.

name: Rum Punch Lodge
description:
the cheapest room with wifi we could find, cheaper than El Mirador and Hotel Maya, 65 bzd @ September 2023

small garage for bikes and motorcycles, no cars or rigs, bad wifi signal in dime rooms but great at lobby and common areas
amazingly equipped kitchen that they let us use, also coffee in the morning

name: Mossiah Downtown Auto Spa
description: Small car wash downtown in a gravel lot.  $5 USD for a motorcycle.  Two guys work hard and do a good job.  It's also busy with locals... good sign.

name: Parking San Pedro Belize Express
description:
We left our motorhome here for 5 days and 4 night. We paid 25 BZD per night. Everything was ok.
Before we went to Radisson but was not available to park there. And we were afraid to leave the MH here (in this park) because of the warning; but, our experience was really good.

Dejamos el motorhome acá por 5 días / 4 noches, pagamos 25 BZD por cada noche. Todo estuvo bien.
Antes de venir acá fuimos al estacionamiento del Radisson pero no era posible parquear ahí.
Y teníamos miedo de venir a este parking por la advertencia que había de años atrás; pero la realidad es que nuestra experiencia fue muy buena acá.

name: D* Victoria Hotel
description:
Decent room generally, just a little small and no way to hang our towels up!  The room we had faced the afternoon sun, so the A/C could barely keep up until the sun went down; not all rooms have this challenge.  There's a decent pool here.  Friendly staff, off-street parking.  There is a place by the pool where motorcycles can be parked securely.  Two double beds / two people for BZD$120.
Close to the Shell gas station and several restaurants.

name: Alan's Paradise Hotel
description:
GPS coord is not the hotel, but the spot where you turn down the path if you have a motorcycle; if not, there is a fenced parking lot signed "Paradise".  The hotel is about 100 yds down the path.  Don't even try to drive down this path if you have anything larger than a golf cart - it's only 5ft wide in spots.
We enjoyed our brief stay at Alan's.  There really is an Alan, and he was a pleasant fellow to chat with.  In fact, while the place had great A/C, great wifi, hot water and a small fridge in the room (two beds, two people for BZD$150/night), and also had a restaurant with decent food and staff that's pretty flexible, the thing we loved most was the atmosphere.  We sat in the restaurant/bar along with several other guests and chatted the night away.  It had a real friendly, comfortable family-like atmosphere.  People were coming and going, joining in the conversation and having a wonderful time.
The dining area is literal feet from the water; bicycles and kayaks are available for guest use.
There is a parking lot a block away for cars; motorcycles can drive down the narrow lane into the secure parking lot.  A shuttle service with golf carts is provided to/from your car.  Look carefully at the photos to find the road into the place.
It's just a short walk to other restaurants, grocery stores and dive shops.

name: Hilltop
description:
Please contact us for dump service. Our name says it all, we are on a hilltop, but no fear, our 33ft RV walked up the dirt road. Plenty of room for any size rig to dump and turn around and get you back on your journey. $20USD$40BZ for use of dump station.

Our campsite location is growing so please be patient and check in with us from informal jungle tent site camps to covered camping to accommodate a large rig with full hook-ups and 30amp avail including wifi. Beautiful, serene views, for your over lander experience.

name: Hacienda Tropical Guest House
description:
A small guesthouse that offers A/C, wifi, hot water and access to the kitchen (including filtered water).
Secure parking is available inside their gated, waist-high fenced yard.  There's room here for all but the largest vehicles.
We paid 135 BZD for two people / 3 single beds.  Grocery story across the street; restaurant, produce, bakery, coffee and ATM within a few hundred meters.

name: Beautiful snack restaurant near the lighthouse and the letters Belize
description:
Just next to the lighthouse and the letters BELIZE, the restaurant "Crème de la crème" welcoms you with delicious and cheap food and drinks. Let's see it on the pictures!

Lance, the boss, is a tour guide for organising great moments for you. You can contact him on his whatsapp: +501-663-6639
He is very welcoming and gives lot of good advices. 

The park just behind is beautiful with aera for kids (movie projection during the WE). The view is great on the ocean. 

You can park for free on the parking lot (ioverlander). It's very safe!

There are a wifi network and bathrooms.

name: The Cosy Restaurant
description:
Very good restaurant where you can eat mexican food (fajitas, burritos), burgers or rice/bean/chicken or beef.
Very tasty.
People welcoming and friendly.

Bathrooms. Free Wifi

name: El Pilar Ancient Mayan City
description: A beautiful Ancient Mayan City, partly renovated and displayed in a very interesting way. We spent 5.5 hours roaming through the site and would have taken more time if we weren't getting to closing hour.

name: Flat platform
description: What a perfect spot found by chance. We arrived at 5pm. We are alone. There are 3 large flat platforms. Access is very easy for any type of vehicle. There are no shadows. The phone signal is very weak with Digi. Very calm.

name: Tropical Oasis
description: The Hostel also offers space for four tents. 20 BZD per tent. Quite place, nice owners.

name: Yamwits Restaurant and Lodge
description:
The Lodge has large grounds on which we were able to camp for $10BZD. The site is off the road, although you can hear the cars it is a quiet road. We picked a flat spot next to some trees. Outdoor bathroom available with running water, toilet and shower.

Very friendly people on site.

name: The Happee Manatee
description:
WE ARE THE LAST DRIVEWAY ON THE ROAD WITH A BLUE METAL GATE. Located right on the beach, we provide access to 3.5 miles of beach to the north, and level camping areas right on the Caribbean. $15 USD /$30 BZD per night per unit. Private outdoor cold water shower, sink and WC (Rain water). Laundry available at $10/load, line dry. A natural well is available with a pump/buckets. Black water dump available $10 BZD. Suggest calling ahead for directions and to ensure we're in to greet you/open the gate, especially on the weekend when our staff is off and we may be off site. 501-673-4211 cell or WhatsApp.
Note that we are totally "off grid". We're happy to provide power and water as the sun and sky provide, but cannot promise either as a certainty.
Please know that Digi has no signal along most of the Coastal Highway at this time. Only Smart signal reaches our location consistently.
Our biggest rig to date has bee a 10m long 4 m high 6x6 MAN truck. We also cater to smaller rigs on two wheels and can provide water and other supplies that are difficult to carry on a motorcycle. 
We are pet friendly and have two dogs on site.
Along the entire coast, sand flies (noseeums, midges) are an issue when the wind is calm and the moisture levels are right. Our location is no exception. We can supply coils to burn ($2 BZD) and bug lotion (Coconut and neem oil mix, 100% organic, $5 BZD) if  needed.

name: Arnold’s Guesthouse
description: Very clean hotel, extremely friendly people. They also have a restaurant and organise tours to the ATM caves. Close to downtown. Paid 109 belize dollars for a night. Breakfast available. Small parking for two motorcycles.

name: Veterinaria El Eden
description:
We did the certificate of good health to bring Abby, our dog to Mexico at this vet. They were very kind (Abby already had all her vaccinations and deworming up to date) so we only had to do the certificate of good health with all the data and it cost us 35 Belizean dollars. And they did it on the spot.
---
Hicimos el certificado de buena salud para ingresar a Abby, nuestra perrita a México en esta veterinaria. Fueron muy amables (Abby ya tenía todo al día sus vacunas y sus desparacitaciones) entonces solo teníamos que hacer el certificado de buena salud con todos los datos y nos costó 35 dólares beliceños. Y lo hicieron en el momento.

name: RV Belize
description:
OWNER DESCRIPTION:  Newly opened, full hook up, RV / Overlander park for ALL size rigs located across the street from the Caribbean Sea on the Placencia Peninsula.  Each slip has potable water, sewer connection and electrical panel with 20/30/50 amp service in all plug configurations.  WiFi available at all slips.  3 fully-covered palapa roof slips and 2 uncovered slips available.  All slips can accommodate large rigs with easy access directly from the Placencia highway.  Pet friendly.  No outdoor camping allowed.  No laundry facilities at this time.   Dump station and potable water fill station is available.

Restaurants, bars, grocery stores, health food store, and golf cart rental all available within walking distance.  Easy kayak launch directly from RV Belize to both the lagoon and sea side.  5 minutes north of Placencia airport and 15 minutes north of Placencia Village. 

RVBelize.com  +501 611-4382 (WhatsApp)

name: SIM Shop: Smart! Phone Plan
description: Place to buy a SIM and plan for Belize. Prepaid plan details in photo. SIM card is an additional $15BZ. People are friendly and helpful.

name: outside dangriga pt2
description: we didn't find the other spot because everything was grown over, so we went a bit further and found this place. hidden from the road because of the tree you have 20m of beach for you and your sandflies :/

name: Shady side road
description: This is a cool, shady, dirt road off the highway that is flat and wide enough to either park or turn around in a big rig. Nice place to make lunch after you’ve stocked up on produce from the fruit/veg stands in town. In the 2 hours I was there, about a dozen pedestrians or bicycles went by.

name: Howler house
description:
Place in the woods, at the river.
Nice and calm.
Caretaker is Shannen and Kenny.

name: Oakburn
description: A little spot by a beautiful creek. Turn on to San Miguel road. We came in from the other road down from San Miguel and the road was a bit gnarly and washed out. No traffic on it. I dipped in the creek for a little rinse and it was lovely. The bridge looks to be unmaintained so no need for people to come this way. Hearing the creek when falling asleep was beautiful. We saw a cat track and there are trail cams on the road. Suitable for SUV size vehicles but not a big rig.

name: Mercado Publico NOMADES
description:
We stayed in the parking lot of the market or public fair. It is also possible to stop on parallel streets. Space for large motorhomes. It has lights at night and security. Everyone very kind. We stayed 3 days. It has good and free Wi-Fi. And the fair operates Tuesday and Thursday. There is more car movement these days. But at night very quiet. Prices for vegetables and fruits are very good. There is a shower for $5 and a toilet for $1.

Ficamos no estacionamento do mercado ou feira pública. Também é possível parar nas ruas paralelas. Espaço para grandes motorhomes. Tem luz a noite e segurança. Todos muito gentis. Ficamos 3 dias. Tem Wi-Fi boa e gratuita. E a feira funciona de Martes e Jueves. Tem mais movimento de carros nesse dia. Mas a noite muito tranquilo. Preços de legumes e frutas muito bom. Tem ducha $5 e banho $1.

name: The Jungle View Restaurant and Campground
description: Beautiful jungle property about a 2 minute drive off the Southern highway. Watch carefully for the small sign. You’ll be glad you found it. The driveway is passable but has a small steep hill/dip that would be tough if your vehicle length is more thank 25’ or so. They have a beautiful outdoor restaurant and bar. Clean toilets and a separate shower. Lots of space to park but call ahead in case they have an event on or something.

name: Splash dive center
description:
The tour we took with them was incredible. They are kind people, great service. There are several tour options, including a diving course.
---
Foi incrível o tour que realizamos com eles. São pessoas gentis, ótimo atendimento. Tem várias opções de tour, inclusive curso de mergulho.

name: Campers robbed at Oasis Campground
description: The camp host and two campers were robbed at gunpoint at the Oasis campground on January 30th 2024. The armed men tied them, searched the tents, took all their belongings and one motorcycle. The story is all over the local news. Someone who knows the campers mentioned that one of the campers was beaten and hurt during the incident. https://www.breakingbelizenews.com/2024/01/30/oasis-camp-site-hit-by-armed-robbers/

name: Lamanai Eco Tours LTD
description:
Spent a very pleasant 3 nights here. Went on the Mayan temple and night wildlife boat tour. Awesome guides. Camping is free if you take a tour not sure how much if you don’t. Current satellite picture does not show the new cleared area we camped in. It’s right by the river with beautiful views.  This was an informal site and still has an informal site listed as a site near the boat ramp. However, they have been developing the back of the property. There is now a very large flat area suitable and open for camping. There is municipal water from the hose bib. Good little bar/restaurant and bathrooms on site, no showers except your hose. If you’re lucky you will see a crocodile in the river, on that note, NO swimming. We thoroughly  enjoyed our stay, loved the people and will return if we come back this way. Couldn’t get the web site to load properly from a normal cut a paste. The Google map link below has a website link that works. 
https://maps.app.goo.gl/2Sf5VeCGG4qwSHcK9?g_st=ic
501-610-1753

name: Border Parking
description:
This is the parkinglot in front of the border (direction guatemala).
There is a sign at the entrance 10BZD for overnightparking, but when we arrived the counter to pay was already closed (no gate for the lot).
This site was recommended to us by the police.

name: Lucca restaurant
description: Huge lot in front of the restaurant, we asked permission to stay the night, no problem, had dinner there. 24hr security. Nice breeze!

name: SmoQiz
description: Perfect place to eat we met the owner Elton from Chicago and he was very welcoming we had breakfast and he let us use the WiFi during our stay the Omelets are amazing Also coffee has free refills.

name: Roadkill shop
description: We had a problem with our promaster and we replace it here Armando and delfín help us a lot the prices were fair and he let us sleep next to his shop.

name: Old Belize Marina
description:
You can park your RV or Trailer long term here. 
Price (March 2023): 5,63 BZD per day.
Open space, no roof.

name: Brew Coffee House
description: Café with a small espresso machine on the main Street in Ladyville, parking is just in front of the building Cappuccino is 9 BLZ Wifi

name: Copy Shop
description:
Copy Shop with computer supplies, you can get print outs here
2 pages 1 BLZ

name: Copy Shop
description: Store with a copy and print machine to get copies of passport. 1 BLZ for color print.

name: Coffee de los Mayas
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Does not meet criteria for Restaurants (must be exceptional (good or bad), have a detailed description, OR be very remote).

Small cafe in the shopping street with good coffee

name: Street parking front the beach
description: Two very quiet nights, public parking, very friendly neighbors, the neighbor came over and said that the place was safe and that there were security cameras in the surrounding houses and the hotel next door, we were there on a monday and tuesday and the bar is nearby  closed..

name: Muj'yal Cafe
description:
We stopped for food and chatted to the owner. He has just started up and is offering camping here as well.

Muj'yal Café
623-3468

 https://g.co/kgs/asG8g6XMuj'yal Café
623-3468

 There is a stony parking area that would be ok for camper vans. I'm sure that tents could be pitched as well. 

The owner is super friendly and seemed like he would go out of his way to accommodate travellers.

Lovely food as well

name: Jaguar Park
description: A pretty spot right on the highway near many local activities. Jaguar Park is a private home and nursery with five acres of gardens and many camping spots as well as a 7.5-acre rainforest remnant with an easy trail. Water, wi-fi, laundry service available, washroom and toilet at the house with separate entrance. Activities in the local village of Maya Centre include a cacao farm & chocolate factory tour, a Maya healer and medicinals shop, two butterfly farms, a women's co-op gift shop, swimming/canoeing in the Sittee River. Access within minutes to the beach, resorts, restaurants, snorkeling, scuba diving, fishing and boat tours in Hopkins; hiking and river tubing at the Cockscomb Jaguar Preserve; horseback trail riding at Outback Trails; hiking and waterfalls at Mayflower-Bocawina National Park; and a  zipline and restaurant at Bocawina resort.

name: Hotel Keystone
description: Keystone hotel parking lot. I left my 25ft RV here for three nights to visit San Pedro. It cost 20 Belizians. Friendly staff. Very safe place: cameras, fences, gates. Walking distance to the boats to the islands.

name: Bladen Nature Reserve
description: If you are going North, there is a pull off on the right side of the road that is good for a night. You are close to the highway but there is very little traffic after dark, and you have some trees blocking you in each direction so you’re not completely exposed. It is directly across the street from a road that leads to “Bfree” and signs that say Bladen Nature Reserve. There is a small clearing just past the end of the road that would be good to set up a tent or hammock, or you could sleep in your vehicle. Very quiet night. Phone service fluctuated between LTE and 3G all night but generally worked pretty good.

name: Blue Creek Cave Hike (Hokeb Ha)
description: One of my favorite hikes in I can’t even remember how long! Park just before the bridge that crosses the river. There will be sign that says “Hokeb Ha Cave” and the trail starts just behind the sign and to the left. Easy to follow for most of the hike until you get past the eco-lodges and get to the river crossing. It will seem like the trail disappears, but if you look directly across the river (I was there in the dry season so it was just rocks), just to the right of a clearing that leads to the river, you should see where it continues. Follow the trail up the right side river bank for a short distance and you will see an enormous cave opening. Wonderful swimming inside and outside the caves, and I even brought my snorkeling mask to look at the fish in the beautiful blue water. Took about 30 minutes to get there and 20 on the way back down. NOTE: if you have children or pets keep your eyes on them at ALL times. There are two small whirlpools (one inside the cave, and one outside of it) that suck water down below the surface. Not dangerous at all if you’re paying attention as they are disconnected from the swimming areas, but it would worry me if I had children or pets with me.

name: Silver Sand Hostel
description:
This is a brand-new Hostel, they opened just a few weeks ago. They have 4 cabanas. Each cabana has 4 beds and one bathroom. The cabana has a fan for the day and AC but only allowed to use during the night between 6 pm and 8 am. 40 Belize Dollars per night.

Outside is a covered place to sit and hammocks. Unfortunately they don't offer a kitchen.

name: Royal Rat Hostel
description:
Shared kitchen with all utilities included, fridge, cookers etc... Shower and toilets men and women's. and also use of the shared swimming pool and court area. 

You can chill on the Lounges and hammocks. There is also a Bar. 

Campervans are welcome. 

Please contact me on What's app or email. Come and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere with us at The Royal Rat Hostel you can also check out our website for more info

name: La Sierra Restaurant Parking Lot Spigot
description: Water spigot next to the yellow pipe under the chain link fencing in the parking lot. There is a hose attachment sitting next to it but I’m not positive if that’s always there or not. Assuming it’s non-potable water, but I was going to be filtering it anyways. Saw a few locals going up to use it while I was eating. Restaurant is not good unless you’re just looking for the cheapest possible meal

name: SAINT Charles Inn
description:
Nice Hotel, AC and hot water. we paid 98 Belize Dollar for a room with two queen-size beds. There was also a fridge and a microwave in the room.
Restaurants and grocery stores in walking distance.

name: Propane
description: Refill for propane tanks, actually, it’s half propane half butane. We didn’t have any issues with the oven or the water heater so it’s good he even lets us fill up our water tank for free.

name: water plant
description: I stopped here for a night at the end of the road very quiet there is a water treatment plant there, but no one bothered me or asked any questions , but I did have to move a little about 9 am so a arctic truck could back up , but all good

name: End of the road
description: I found this spot and stopped here for two days right at the end of a track you turn right and go through a bit of a rubbish dump and go right to the end , there are a few spots along the way , turn left at the roundabout on the main road if  heading south a little windy but keep the bug's away, ok In a van , but not when it's wet .

name: End of a Track at sennis River
description: this is a nice little Spot at the end of a track by sennis River, lot's of room , off monkey river road on a dirt track, doable in a 2wd van (just) when dry , no hope when wet , 4x4 wood be better, little overgrown so you will get some pin striping ..a bit of little about , you might see a couple of fisher men but friendly. big rigs will probably be ok there space , but it might be tight to get there but there is other spots before you get here ..

name: by the sea
description: it's a very over grown track mid size 4x4 is ok the track runs down the side of a fence, end's up in a small spot all room for two motors, I didn't stop as it was too early for me a little trash but not much used .ok for a night to two under the trees .

name: Esso landing
description: I do like this place at the end of a track down waterhole road , ok in any motor but if wet you will get stuck (2WD)  friends got to 100 yards to the end in there camper van but it was raining all day and some of the road is clay... he got very stuck , but 4x4 is fine , lots of space when you get there.

name: Aquazul
description: Purified water. They can fill jugs, didn’t ask about tanks. $3 Belize per garafon

name: Grace Hotel and Restaurant- money exchange
description:
We needed just a few more Belize dollars to pay to for ferry but didn’t want to pay the ATM fees. The restaurant changed some Quetzals for a good rate.

Didn’t stay at the hotel or eat in the restaurant but it looked nice.

name: Free WiFi no password
description: Free open WiFi in the park on the opposite corner from the Belize bank. Nice iced coffee from the stall there too.

name: Elsa‘s Laundry
description: Laundry service: 15 BZD for 1 load and dryer. Same day pick up if you bring it in the morning. Very friendly lady.

name: The Shipyard Bar and Grill
description: FANTASTIC spot heading to Belize City!! Restaurant with a pool, shower, electricity, toilets, non-potable water, free Wifi (until 9pm) and two guards at night. Just get some food or drinks at the restaurant. Level and good for big rigs too. You can even go fishing at the Boatyard if you ask the manager. And if you are lucky you can spot a Manatee. As there are not many guest you practically have the pool for yourself

name: Joe Jo’s
description: Great little place if you’re looking to visit Tobacco Caye. We left our rigs in Dangriga at a hotel and stayed here for 5 nights and what a nice vacation after 6 months straight in our vans and the heat of the Belize mainland. Mariela and her family were wonderful hosts. Cabanas were simple but breezy with fans in each room and ocean views. All meals are included and were delicious prepared. Snorkeling was great right off the pier at Reef End. We saw manatees, rays, octopus, cuttlefish and squid right out front. We did some night snorkeling on our own but if you don’t have lights you can arrange for a tour. We did a snorkel tour one day with noble and the aquarium spot he took us was beautiful, insane visibility and we saw couple nurse sharks. Free kayaks and paddle boards so we took those out daily. there’s another good reef you can kayak too for a change of pace with the snorkeling. There is a mooring ball so you can leave the kayak there and take a quick swim. joe Jo’s doesn’t have a bar so pack alcohol or go down to Reefs End for a beautiful sunset cocktail. we loved it and will definitely be back!

name: Veterinario pawtronus
description:
A very honest and kind veterinarian did the veterinary certificate for my pet to go to Mexico. He charged me 35 BLZ.
---
Un veterinario muy honesto y muy amable me hizo el certificado veterinario para mi mascota para pasar a México. Me cobró 35 BLZ.

name: Drop off Laundry
description: Super quick and well done drop off laundry service. Small hut with laundry machines. We showed up at 1.30pm and our big bag of laundry was clean and folded at 4.30 pm. Cost us 22 $ BLZ for more about 7kg.
